description:
Sobre a vaga
Posição: Analista de Gestão de Dados
Área: TI
Local de Trabalho: São Paulo (Híbrido)

Desafio:
A Moove está buscando um Analista de Gestão de Dados para a área de Tecnologia que participará ativamente nas demandas e projetos se comunicando com todas as áreas de negócios. Utilizará as ferramentas disponíveis para extração, transformação e disponibilização dos dados para todas as unidades de negócios e participará na definição de novas ferramentas conforme as necessidades de dados e/ou negócios.

Principais Responsabilidades:

- Participar na definição e implementação de melhores práticas de arquitetura e modelagem de dados;
- Desenvolver, aprimorar e suportar fluxos de trabalho e processos de transformação de dados, incluindo preparação e orquestração de dados em larga escala e integração via API;
- Definir tarefas de desenvolvimento detalhadas, dependências de tarefas e estimativas para concluir o trabalho;
- Identificar proativamente problemas, além de apresentar e se necessário desenvolver soluções;
- Trabalhar com parceiros de negócios para priorizar as necessidades de negócios e informações;
- Comunicar-se efetivamente com as partes interessadas internas e a gestão.

Qualificações:
- Experiência de trabalho em ambientes SQL Server, SSIS, Azure Data Lake Storage Gen 2;
- Experiência trabalhando com ferramentas ETL como Alteryx, Azure Data Factory, Theobald;
- Conhecimento em Data Warehouse como conceitos, práticas e procedimentos;
- Conhecimento de ferramentas como SAP ECC e salesforce;
- Ensino Superior em Tecnologia da Informação
- Inglês Avançado

Benefícios

Participação nos lucros
Vale-refeição/ Refeitório
Programa de Apoio ao Funcionário
Assistência médica e odontológica
Auxílio farmácia
Seguro de vida
Previdência privada
Gympass
Auxílio Óptico
ATS
Vale Transporte/ Estacionamento

description:
Sobre a vaga
Love sports?

We're looking for someone like you.

Job type - Contract based (Not part-time or full-time)

Get to know us - https://geniussports.com/statisticians-network/

This is an opportunity for exciting and fast-paced work as a Football Statistician.

If you enjoy sports and would like to become a part of the sports industry, this could be your chance! You will get thorough training in using the company software which is used for entering the data in order to provide the best analyses of the game possible.

Requirements:
You are reliable, committed, organized, and honest.
Above-average Football knowledge with regard to the Laws of the Game, basic tactics, and jargon
Regular availability on weekends and weekday evenings
Regular internet access
Access to Skype and YouTube for meetings and training tools

Interested and want to learn more?
Tell us a bit about yourself and we'll be in touch with you for more information about becoming sports a statistician. You must be 18 or older to apply.

Description

Missão do cargo

Desenvolvimento e suporte em atividades de administração da infraestrutura da Tecnologia da Informação, garantindo a disponibilidade e segurança dos recursos disponíveis, suportando o negócio.

Métricas de Sucesso
Primeiro nível de suporte na LATAM (Brasil, Argentina, México e USA)
Suporte à Plataforma do Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, MS Teams, OneNote, entre outros)

Garantir o funcionamento da infraestrutura como salas de reuniões, equipamentos áudio visual, pontos de redes, backup, WiFi etc.
Acompanhamento diário das pendências de atualizações de computadores de usuários garantindo que estejam em conformidade com as diretivas da corporação.
Manter nossos registros de ativos de TI atualizados no sistema.
Instalação de software em geral para uso quando necessário
Captura, acompanhamento e fechamentos dos tickets de TI

description:
Sobre a vaga
Analista Privacidade de Dados Sr – Prazo Determinado (6 meses)

A SUA ENERGIA FAZ A CPFL

Inovamos para oferecer as melhores soluções aos nossos clientes e trabalhamos de maneira colaborativa para entregar os melhores resultados e alcançar a excelência em tudo o que fazemos. Geramos valor de forma sustentável, atuando sempre com responsabilidade social, integridade, transparência e segurança. Para nós, o desenvolvimento de colaboradoras e colaboradores caminha junto com o crescimento da CPFL.

O Nosso Jeito de Ser valoriza a diversidade e respeita as diferenças, por isso praticamos ações afirmativas em que reservamos vagas para aumentar cada vez mais a representatividade de grupos sociais minorizados, como por exemplo, mulheres, pessoas com deficiência e pessoas negras. Essas ações fazem parte da nossa estratégia e compromissos para uma cultura inclusiva. Conheça mais sobre nosso posicionamento em link (https://cpfl.riweb.com.br/show.aspx?idCanal=m1DU2SlCXo7pvQ/fBEMIxg==)

Se você se identifica com os nossos valores e acredita que pode fazer a diferença para os nossos negócios, venha compartilhar a sua energia e crescer com a CPFL.

Onde você vai atuar: Campinas- SP

Empresa: Cia Piratininga Força Luz – Uma empresa do grupo CPFL Energia

Principais Atividades:

Apoiar nas atividades de mapeamento e avaliação de riscos de privacidade em Proteção de Dados Pessoais (processos, produtos e serviços) e dar suporte na avaliação do risco relevante de proteção de dados na hipótese de incidente de segurança envolvendo dados pessoais. Dar suporte na atualização dos inventários de dados da organização.
Apoiar na atualização da matriz de riscos e controles internos de Proteção de Dados Pessoais e no cumprimento do cronograma de avaliação dos controles, propondo melhorias sempre que identificadas.
Monitorar os indicadores e controles internos relacionados a Privacidade em Proteção de Dados Pessoais visando a conformidade e cumprimento do Programa de Privacidade e Proteção de Dados. Manter os indicadores de Proteção de Dados atualizados, apoiar esforços de revisão, melhorias e automação. Divulgar indicadores para o público adequado conforme calendário da área.
Manter políticas e normas atualizadas sob orientação da liderança.
Apoiar e conduzir follow up dos riscos de privacidade identificadas junto as áreas de negócio

O que buscamos:

Ensino Superior Completo (Administração, Economica, Contabilidade e afins)
Experiência na avaliação de riscos de privacidade de dados, controles internos e Compliance
Habilidade com análise da dados, definição de métricas e indicadores
Habilidades com excel pacote office
Necessário Inglês Intermediário (criação e interpretação de documentos)
Desejável conhecimento em Power BI - intermediário (gráficos, dashboards)
Desejável conhecimentos de LGPD
Desejável conhecimento em ferramentas de gestão de privacidade

O que oferecemos:
Vale Transporte;
Vale Refeição;
Assistência Médica;
Assistência Odontológica;
Auxílio creche (conforme regras de elegibilidade);
Seguro de Vida;
PLR;
Gympass;
Programa Fale Comigo (assessoria gratuita e sigilosa via telefone para auxílio psicológico, jurídico, financeiro, social e fonoaudiólogo).

O Grupo CPFL Energia

A CPFL Energia, há 109 anos no setor elétrico, atua nos segmentos de distribuição, geração, transmissão, comercialização e serviços. Desde janeiro de 2017, o Grupo faz parte da State Grid, estatal chinesa que é a terceira maior organização empresarial do mundo e a maior empresa de energia elétrica, atendendo 88% do território chinês e com operações na Itália, Austrália, Portugal, Filipinas e Hong Kong.

Com 14% de participação, a CPFL Energia é uma das maiores empresas no mercado de distribuição, totalizando mais de 9,9 milhões de clientes em 687 cidades, entre os estados de São Paulo, Rio Grande do Sul, Minas Gerais e Paraná.

Na comercialização, é uma das líderes no mercado livre, com participação de mercado de 4%. É líder na comercialização de energia incentivada para clientes livres entre as comercializadoras.

Na geração, é a terceira maior agente privada do País, com capacidade instalada de 4.305 MW, no final de setembro de 2020. Tem um portfólio baseado em fontes limpas e renováveis, como grandes hidrelétricas, usinas eólicas, térmicas a biomassa, Pequenas Centrais Hidrelétricas (PCH) e usina solar. A CPFL Renováveis é a maior empresa de geração da América Latina a partir de fontes alternativas de energia.

A CPFL Energia possui ações listadas no Novo Mercado da B3. O Grupo também ocupa posição de destaque em arte e cultura, entre os maiores investidores brasileiros, por meio do Instituto CPFL.

description:
Sobre a vaga
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:

Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently

It’s Great if you Have:

Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Sobre a vaga
About The Internship

We're looking for a Data Analyst / Scientist intern to join our Safety Marketplace team to provide data expertise as we work to make this world a safer place to move around. In this role, you'll be part of and work closely with a cross-functional team consisting of engineers, product managers, safety ops, as well as other data scientists and applied scientists. This role will perform analyses related to our machine learning-based products.

What You’ll Do

Develop dashboards, pull data for analyses, build readouts for scientific experiments, opportunity sizing analyses, rule creation, review work by team members, and present results to the team.

Basic Qualifications

Written and spoken proficiency in English and in Portuguese
Currently enrolled in Master’s or Ph.D. degree
Availability to work 3 months full time in 2023 starting in June (flexible start date)
Working rights in Brazil (no sponsorship available)
Skills in Analytics, SQL, Python, dashboarding, stats

Bonus Points If

See the forest **and** the trees: Strong data analytics, you know the details that matter
Trip obsessed: Taking time to build helpful relationships, you earn the trust of others within Uber through strong situational awareness and reliability
One Uber: You demonstrate optimism, respect others and work well in a team
Go get it: Understanding and being fully aware of how our business operates and how it makes money and sustains profitable growth, now and in the future
Great minds don’t think alike: diversity of thought in teams makes us stronger.
Bonus points for experimentation (e.g. A/B testing) and machine learning

Internships @ Uber

You have the rare chance to create a global impact - we're moving real people and assets and reinventing transportation and logistics. We offer expansive mentorship from Uber employees to guide you through your internship experience and for you to build personal networks and friendships with hardworking people who share your passion for technology.

Uber is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Offices continue to be central to collaboration and Uber’s cultural identity. Unless formally approved to work fully remotely, Uber expects employees to spend at least half of their work time in their assigned office. For certain roles, such as those based at green-light hubs, employees are expected to be in-office for 100% of their time. Please speak with your recruiter to better understand in-office expectations for this role.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

O esporte nos move e acreditamos no seu poder de transformar vidas. Estamos construindo um ecossistema para integrar a experiência do atleta amador, profissional ou ocasional, aquele que busca o esporte por bem-estar, diversão ou como estilo de vida. Esse Grupo, que segue em constante expansão para os apaixonados por esporte, conta hoje com a Centauro, a maior varejista esportiva multimarcas da América Latina, a Fisia, com a distribuição oficial da marca Nike no Brasil, a FitDance, referência no ensino e prática de dança, a NWB, a maior produtora de conteúdo de esporte na internet, a OneFan, que conecta clubes de futebol a torcedores e a X3m, de sportainment com grandes eventos esportivos em seu portfólio. Todos têm lugar em nosso time! Nós queremos ser referência para toda e qualquer pessoa que pensar em esporte no Brasil. E aí, que tal vestir a nossa camisa? #SomosSBF

Parte desse ecossistema de esportes acontece dentro da NWB, e para que tenhamos sucesso no novo momento de evolução para se tornar uma Content Tech precisamos acompanhar de pertos os processos internos e integrar novos sistemas e rotinas no dia a dia da empresa.

A vaga de Analista de Controladoria Júnior é extremamente estratégica uma vez que além de fazer acompanhamento e análise do preenchimento de alguns sistemas chave para a operação da empresa, terá interface diária com diversas áreas como Operações, Dados e CSC, por exemplo.

Responsibilities and assignments

Sobre a posição:



Com regime de contratação PJ você entrará no jogo, com as seguintes atividades:
Acompanhamento de preenchimento dos sistemas;
Estruturação de relatórios a partir dos preenchimentos;
Implementação de rotinas de feedback para áreas com interface com os sistemas chave;
Ser ponto focal entre CSC GSBF e áreas executoras de custos da NWB;
Desenhar e implementar processos;
Desenvolver familiaridade com os sistemas de gestão da NWB (Pipedrive, WK Radar e Trello);
Auxiliar na mensuração de conformidade na execução dos processos internos.

Requirements And Qualifications

O que você precisa para essa posição no jogo:
Familiaridade com CRMs e/ou ERPs;
Experiência com desenho e implementação de processos;
Boa comunicação com diferentes áreas internas;
Raciocínio analítico;
Trabalho em equipe.

Additional information

Vem pro jogo com a gente!

SOBRE NÓS

Nós acreditamos no poder transformador que o esporte tem na vida das pessoas, seja por saúde e bem-estar, ganho de autoestima e confiança, socialização ou inclusão social.

Assim é o Grupo SBF, um #ecossistemadoesporte criado para atender necessidades dos mais diversos perfis de consumidores, além de apoiá-los durante toda a sua jornada esportiva. Para isso, conectamos milhões de pessoas a produtos, serviços, conteúdos e experiências.

Com sede em São Paulo, o Grupo conta com cerca de 10 mil colaboradores, chamados de atletas, distribuídos por nossa estrutura corporativa, o HUB, e nossas três unidades de negócio: a Centauro, a Fisia e a SBF Ventures.

A Centauro é a maior varejista multicanal de artigos esportivos da América Latina, com mais de 232 lojas espalhadas por 25 estados brasileiros, além do Distrito Federal, e forte presença no digital. Além da tradição no mercado brasileiro, a Centauro oferece serviços e experiências personalizadas para cada perfil de consumidor, auxiliando no processo de compra e democratizando a prática esportiva no país. Com mais de 40 anos de história, emprega cerca de 8 mil colaboradores.

A Fisia é a distribuidora oficial da Nike no Brasil, que conta com uma operação 22 lojas próprias no país, forte atuação no mercado de B2B e profunda conexão com a comunidade esportiva e com os consumidores de uma das marcas mais admiradas do planeta.

A SBF Ventures é a nossa unidade de negócio dedicada a alavancar novos negócios e oportunidades para o Grupo. Em seu portfólio estão a NWB - Network Brasil, a OneFan, a X3m e a FitDance.

A NWB é a maior rede digital de esportes do Brasil, com grande audiência em seus canais próprios como Desimpedidos e Camisa 21, além de canais afiliados e agenciamento de talentos do esporte.

A OneFan aproxima torcedores e fãs com as entidades esportivas, por meio do seu superapp para promover sportainment. A plataforma conta com mais de 850 mil usuários, e hoje é o aplicativo oficial de times como o Fortaleza, São Paulo, Atlético Mineiro, Coritiba e Flamengo, além de clubes internacionais.

A X3m é uma empresa de live marketing esportivo e oferece experiências inovadoras no segmento de corrida e eventos ao ar livre, como o XTerra, e gerenciando marcas próprias já consolidadas no mercado, como o Uphill Marathon e corridas de subida.

A mais nova investida do Grupo é a FitDance, que soma mais de 10 bilhões de visualizações desde a sua criação, impactando 15 milhões de pessoas, em mais de 50 países.

É apaixonado(a) por esporte e quer contribuir para transformar esse mercado no Brasil? Venha fazer parte do nosso ecossistema!

position: ANALISTA DE LOGÍSTICA JR - SAPEZAL / MT
company: {'name': 'Cargill', 'size': '+ de 10.001 funcionários', 'sector': 'Fabricação de alimentos e bebidas'}
required_skills: ['Entrada de dados', 'Consignment', 'Documentação', 'Gestão de dados', 'Gestão de recursos', 'Interação com clientes', 'Operações de produção', 'Procedimentos de conformidade', 'Relatórios e análises', 'Suporte administrativo']
description:
Sobre a vaga
PROPÓSITO E IMPACTO DO TRABALHO

O(a) Analista de Logística JR realizará atividades de produção em um local de fabricação ou campo para otimizar o uso de recursos, minimizar custos e manter padrões de qualidade. Buscamos um profissional que nos ajude a realizar gestão de dados, relatórios e análises, envio, interação com clientes, parceria comercial e pessoas, gestão de recursos, orçamento e projetos.

PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES
Contribuir para o desenvolvimento, manutenção e execução de procedimentos de conformidade regulatória.
Solicitar, coletar e organizar documentação e dados, realizando a entrada de dados de rotina em um ou mais sistemas.
Planejar, gerenciar e revisar as operações de produção para alcançar objetivos de produção e qualidade;
Realizar funções administrativas ou clerical em apoio ao processo de execução da remessa, completando tarefas utilizando procedimentos padrão do setor.
Lidar com questões complexas de suporte administrativo, administrativo, técnico ou de cliente sob supervisão mínima, ao mesmo tempo em que escala apenas as questões mais complexas para a equipe apropriada.

QUALIFICAÇÕES
Superior cursando
Conhecimento pacote office intermediário
Desejável experiência na área de transporte e/ou logística
Diferencial experiência em empresas do Agro

Na Cargill, todas as pessoas são importantes. A Cargill está comprometida em criar e manter um ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e diversificado, onde todos e todas são tratados com dignidade e respeito. Alinhada com nossos Princípios e Valores, a Cargill proíbe qualquer tipo de discriminação e  assédio contra qualquer pessoa ou candidato (a) no que diz respeito a: raça, etnia, cor, religião, nacionalidade, ascendência, sexo, gênero, identidade de gênero, expressão de gênero, orientação sexual, idade, deficiência, gravidez, informações genéticas, estado civil, status familiar, país de origem, afiliação a sindicato ou qualquer outro status protegido por lei. A Cargill também cumpre todas as leis e regulamentos nacionais e locais aplicáveis, relativos à não discriminação e empregabilidade.

A Cargill encoraja a vacinação contra a Covid-19 mas não obriga neste momento. Durante o processo admissional, você será questionado sobre seu status de vacinação, e se não for vacinado ou preferir não informar, é esperado que você siga protocolos específicos para empregado(as) não vacinados (exemplo: uso obrigatório de máscara, distanciamento social, restrição de acesso às instalações, etc).

description:
Sobre a vaga
Become a freelance Data Collector!

Data collection is the process of gathering and measuring information, in a way that allows you to answer questions and evaluate outcomes. The process of data collecting is easy-going and requires the accurate entry of information into a database. The work you’ll be doing will help companies answer research questions, test hypotheses, and even train artificial intelligence/machine learning models.


What You Can Expect:
Short-term commitment, the potential to work long-term
Flexible work schedule
Some projects may ask you to work a designated number of hours each week


Qualifications & Equipment Needed:
No prior data collection experience is necessary
Fluent spoken and written skills in English and the language specified in the role on the application page
Smartphone device, Android or iOS
Personal computer or laptop
Stable internet connection


Join the fun with AI Technology! Become an Appen Contributor!


We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


Thank you and we hope to work with you soon!


"Appen has a diverse, inclusive culture that is vital to our mission of helping build better AI. We offer opportunities for individuals of all abilities and backgrounds."

company: {'name': 'PepsiCo', 'size': '+ de 10.001 funcionários', 'sector': 'Serviços de alimentos e bebidas'}
required_skills: ['Comunicação', 'Análise de informações', 'Custos de produção', 'Gestão da informação', 'Gestão de operações de fabricação', 'Habilidades analíticas', 'Indicadores-chave de desempenho', 'Produtos SAP', 'Redução de custos', 'Relatórios de indicadores-chave de desempenho (KPI)']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Overview

Os produtos da PepsiCo são apreciados pelos consumidores e consumidoras mais de um bilhão de vezes por dia em mais de 200 países e territórios ao redor do mundo. A PepsiCo gerou mais de US$ 79 bilhões em receita líquida em 2021, impulsionada por um portfólio de bebidas e alimentos convenientes que inclui LAY’S ®, DORITOS ®, CHEETOS ®, GATORADE ®, PEPSI ®, QUAKER ®, entre outros. O portfólio de produtos da PepsiCo inclui uma ampla variedade de alimentos e bebidas agradáveis, incluindo muitas marcas icônicas que geram mais de US$ 1 bilhão cada em vendas anuais estimadas no varejo.

Nossa visão é ser líder global em alimentos e bebidas convenientes ao vencer com PepsiCo Positive (pep+). pep+ é o nome dado à transformação estratégica que estamos trazendo para o nosso negócio, de ponta a ponta, criando crescimento e valor ao mesmo tempo em que inspiramos mudanças positivas para o planeta e para as pessoas.

Nossa gente impulsiona nossa cultura. Não há dois dias iguais; somos dinâmicos e cheios de equipes apaixonadas que abraçam novas ideias através do nosso espírito colaborativo. Na PepsiCo, temos o compromisso de promover uma força de trabalho diversa, criando um espaço colaborativo, equitativo e inclusivo onde todos(as) - independentemente de nossa aparência, de onde viemos ou de quem amamos - tenham voz. Na PepsiCo temos um espaço para ser Únic( )s.

Conheça mais da nossa cultura em: https://stories.pepsicojobs.com/

Responsibilities

O que você vai exercer:

Responsible for manufacturing management reports, and deep analysis in order to guide plant leaders to identify initiatives. Detect opportunities for continuous improvement and innovation in the analysis and reports.

Carry out a critical evaluation of productivity rationales, validating if target is feasible, data is real and calculation is appropriated based on the project scope.
Develop periodic analysis of the numbers’ evolution from plan and year ago versus actual of Manufacturing cost in order to suggest specific initiatives related to productivity/cost reduction.
Identify oportunities to be replicated to the others plants in the same category, mainly.
Manage Manufacturing Write-Off, attending meetings and monitoring the KPI with Quality and Controll.
Support Manufacturing team and other areas, as Maintenance and EHS, to clarify issues/doubts related to spent in all categories of Brazil.
Elaborate and improve management reports to all Brazil plants.
Participate and coordinate costs workshops.
Train and develop new employees of Manufacturing, Maintenance, and MOTOR+ teams, sharing the concepts and promoting the awareness of costs in PepsiCo.

Qualifications

Quem estamos buscando?

Education: Business Administration, Engineering, or similar.
Experience: minimum 2 years in similar position.
Knowledge in basic finance, Manufacturing KPIs.
Advanced Excel and ppt skills, familiar with SAP.
English and Spanish intermediate level.
Personal Profile: Analytical, Capable of synthesis, Task Priorization, Creative, Dynamic, great in communication skills and multifunctional teamwork.

The most important challenges of this position are guaranteeing information flows and alignments regarding costs, maintaining high forecast accuracy, timely deliver and influence other areas in correctly managing accounts and cost centers, implementing a new cost culture, and to ensure continuos improvement in data management.

Complexities of the position: quickly create connection between different issues, high need for planning and governance execution, frequent contact with different levels (hability to adapt the speech), constantly report and access by managers and directors.

O que você pode esperar de nós:

Um ambiente de trabalho híbrido que promove um equilíbrio saudável entre vida pessoal e profissional;
Uma cultura dinâmica e inclusiva;
Uma equipe de apoio que irá encorajar o seu crescimento e desenvolvimento profissional;
Oportunidade de trabalhar com projetos relevantes e impactantes para o negócio;
Oportunidade de retribuir à comunidade com nossos Programas de Voluntariado;
Oferecemos uma plataforma para desenvolvimento de idiomas 100% gratuita"

Na PepsiCo, valorizamos a diversidade e a inclusão e reconhecemos como a coisa certa a fazer para o nosso negócio e sociedade. A PepsiCo é uma empresa que oferece oportunidades únicas e contrata pessoas qualificadas e diversas, independente de sexo, raça, identidade de gênero, religião, nacionalidade, idade ou deficiência.

Acreditamos que somos Mais Fortes quando temos representatividade dentro da companhia, independentemente de nossa aparência, de onde viemos ou de quem amamos. A diversidade de talentos e um ambiente inclusivo promovem o engajamento dos(as) funcionários(as), promovem a criatividade e impulsionam a inovação.

"A companhia se reserva o direito de modificar as especificações, habilidades e requerimentos da

posição de acordo com suas necessidades."

Atenção aos critérios de elegibilidade para candidatos(as) internos(as):

Estar há pelo menos doze (12) meses em sua posição atual;
Notificar seu(sua) líder sobre seu interesse na vaga;
Não possuir avaliação inferior a 2 nos últimos dois anos;
Não ter tido nenhuma suspensão como medida disciplinar nos últimos doze meses.

required_skills: ['Análise de dados', 'Banco de dados', 'Comunicação', 'Analítica', 'Dashboards', 'Inteligência de mercado', 'Inteligência de negócios (BI)', 'Mineração de dados', 'Pensamento crítico', 'Visualização de dados']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Descrição da vaga

Estamos buscando um Analista de Business Intelligence para se unir à nossa equipe de Analytics Customer Success. O Analista de Business Intelligence apoia no gerenciamento de entregas analíticas para médias e grandes contas, desenvolvendo apresentações e buscando entregar recomendações acionáveis alinhadas com as prioridades dos clientes. Nesta posição o associado atua através de forte orientação analítica e relacionamento, contribuindo para o crescimento e desenvolvimento de nossos clientes de acordo com suas estratégias e objetivos.

Na NIQ você ingressará em uma companhia líder do setor de Consumer Intelligence, que leva ao mundo uma visão completa de mercado sobre o consumidor, com mais canais e mais categorias do que nunca. Empoderamos e capacitamos nossos associados, permitindo-lhes alcançar seus objetivos da maneira que sentirem melhor funcionar para eles, encontrando sempre parcerias dispostas a ir além para ajudá-los alcançar o que desejam!

Responsabilidades

Desenvolver análises de acordo com o briefing do cliente e prioridades estratégicas, atuando com as ferramentas da NielsenIQ
Conhecer o histórico do cliente (categorias, marcas, desempenho, etc.), movimentações das marcas, além de fortalezas e prioridades, com o objetivo de gerar recomendações claras e mensuradas
Atuar como pessoa chave em termos de entrega analítica, compreendendo também a cultura do cliente e como ela influencia no relacionamento
Negociar prazos de entrega, sinalizando riscos internamente e propondo alternativas
Liderar o alinhamento com a equipe interna de Customer Service em casos críticos, para comunicação junto ao cliente
Organizar e atender solicitações conforme prazos acordados e nível de qualidade, oferecendo visibilidade ao cliente sobre o andamento de temas analíticos
Auxiliar e orientar membros mais Juniors do time, respondendo às dúvidas do dia a dia e contribuindo para um clima positivo e engajamento da equipe

Qualificações

Graduação Completa (preferencialmente em Marketing, Publicidade e Propaganda, Relações Internacionais, Economia, Engenharia, Administração de Empresas, ou cursos relacionados)
Atuação prévia com análise de dados em Inteligência de Mercado é essencial
Conhecimento e vivência no mercado de FMCG
Compreensão de cenários macroeconômicos
Forte skill analítico e consultivo
Domínio Pacote Office, principalmente Excel e Power Point (desejável Power BI)
Desejável Inglês Avançado
Curiosidade, comunicação e pensamento crítico são habilidades essenciais

Informações adicionais

Nossos Benefícios

Ambiente de Trabalho Flexível (Modelo de Trabalho Híbrido)
Desenvolvimento de Carreira personalizado para as oportunidades da NielsenIQ
Programa Global de Mentoria
Vasto e aprofundado programa de aprendizado, com acesso a treinamentos diversificados (business, ferramentas técnicas e analíticas, soft skills, entre outros) para desenvolvimento sob demanda, além de acesso a conteúdo exclusivo em comunidades sociais NIQ
Programa de Reconhecimento
Short Friday
Gympass
PLR
Assistência Médica e Odontológica

E mais!

Job ID: REFID331128

About NIQ

NIQ, the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, reveals new pathways to growth for retailers and consumer goods manufacturers. With operations in more than 100 countries, NIQ delivers the most complete and clear understanding of consumer buying behavior through an advanced business intelligence platform with integrated predictive analytics. NIQ delivers the Full View.

NIQ was founded in 1923 and is an Advent International portfolio company. For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with the latest updates on our business and #LifeAtNIQ? Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide.

Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NielsenIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion/

NIQ or any of our subsidiaries will never ask you for money at any point of the recruitment or onboarding process.

required_skills: ['Análise de dados', 'Comunicação', 'Analítica de dados', 'Apresentações', 'Habilidades analíticas', 'JSON', 'Metadados', 'Technical Instruction', 'Timelines', 'Visualização de dados']
description:
Sobre a vaga
At Nielsen, we believe that career growth is a partnership. You ultimately own, fuel and set the journey. By joining our team of nearly 14,000 associates, you will become part of a community that will help you to succeed. We champion you because when you succeed, we do too. Embark on a new initiative, explore a fresh approach, and take license to think big, so we can all continuously improve. We enable your best to power our future.

The Data Ingest Analyst performs editorial, administrative and analytical functions related to the ongoing development and creation of media databases and content, specifically in the audiovisual sphere. This person will be responsible for securing text and image data related to TV Series, Movies and Sports airing on TV or video-on-demand and which will in turn enable various Content Video teams to perform complex manipulations on the entertainment information that forms the core of Gracenote’s media database.

Responsibilities

Source and acquire metadata content & issue technical instruction to internal Engineering teams.
Establish relationships with Content Providers in the media industry market space.
Establish relationships and facilitate internal & Client facing support cases by analyzing market trends, supporting challenges and driving improvement.
Execute process, system & data related tasks & functions with quality, accuracy, & timeliness for portfolio of assigned work.
Build and maintain a proficient subject matter knowledge of Reference related applications, processes, data, and SLA’s.
Understand team strategies and processes to ensure product quality and client satisfaction, and lead continuous improvement of products, processes, and/or services.
Adhere to standards around process, procedure, training, certification and deployment needs.
Report key performance metrics that provide insight into operations health and control, and that align with client/market needs.

Requirements/Qualifications

BA/BS degree or equivalent demonstrated experience.
Proficient MS Excel skill set, with a working knowledge of JSON data interchange and XML transmission processes.
Fluent written and verbal English and Portuguese communication skills.
Ability to analyze data scenarios, handle workflows, & navigate across multiple systems & processes.
Ability to make independent decisions while facilitating discussion & communicating information clearly, tactfully & professionally.
Ability to develop compelling & persuasive presentation material.
Strong interpersonal and organizational communication skills that develop effective relationships with stakeholders.
Proficiency with Google Suite & MS Office products.
Working hours - 12:00pm to 9:00pm from Monday to Friday

As the arbiter of truth, Nielsen Global Media fuels the media industry with unbiased, reliable data about what people watch and listen to. To discover what’s true, we measure across all channels and platforms⁠—from podcasts to streaming TV to social media. And when companies and advertisers are armed with the truth, they have a deeper understanding of their audiences and can accelerate growth.

Do you want to move the industry forward with Nielsen? Our people are the driving force. Your thoughts, ideas and expertise can propel us forward. Whether you have fresh thinking around maximizing a new technology or you see a gap in the market, we are here to listen and take action. Our team is made strong by a diversity of thoughts, experiences, skills, and backgrounds. You’ll enjoy working with smart, fun, curious colleagues, who are passionate about their work. Come be part of a team that motivates you to do your best work!

description:
Sobre a vaga
Love sports?

We're looking for someone like you!

Job type - Contract based (Not part-time or full-time)

Get to know us - https://geniussports.com/statisticians-network/

This is an opportunity for exciting and fast-paced work as a Football Statistician.

If you enjoy sports and would like to become a part of the sports industry, this could be your chance! You will get thorough training in using the company software which is used for entering the data to provide the best analyses of the game possible.

You are reliable, committed, organized, and honest

required_skills: ['Capacidade de organização', 'Comunicação', 'Apresentações', 'Banco de investimento', 'Ciência de dados', 'Comunicação escrita', 'Comércio eletrônico', 'Marketing digital', 'Serviços de publicidade online', 'Teste A/B']
description:
Sobre a vaga
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to know our team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:

Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently

It’s great if you have:

Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

required_skills: ['Comunicação', 'Query Languages', 'Analítica de dados', 'Análise de dados nos negócios', 'Análise de negócios', 'Mapeamento de processos', 'Melhoria de processos', 'Relatórios e análises', 'Requisitos de negócio', 'Tomada de decisões baseadas em dados']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s food ingredients and bio-industrial business, where we anticipate trends around taste, nutrition and safety to innovate and provide solutions to manufacturers, retailers and foodservice companies.

Job Purpose and Impact

The Analytics Data Process Analyst will develop an in depth understanding of the business to innovate significant data driven insights to help business leaders make better decisions and will develop and combine subject matter expertise in key data domains. Our aim is to empower the business to unlock value from data assets, uplift analytical capabilities and support data-driven decision making across the organization. In this role, you will act as a partner with internal stakeholders and technical staff to execute a business technology strategy that delivers reporting and analytics solutions. You will work closely with business teams to help explore how data and analytics solutions can address business needs. Together with business and technical stakeholders at the group, functional and regional level you will co-create and deliver data and analytics solutions.

Key Accountabilities
Identify and analyze business needs, gather requirements and define the scope and objectives to drive business decisions.
Prepare data and explore new potential data to support reporting and analysis initiatives.
Prepare reports and analysis to identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets for values and new opportunities.
Lead analysis in collaboration with process and operations leadership to identify the top opportunities for improvement and track progress and impact on future results.
Mentor and coach peers and recommend process improvements related to delivery and new methodologies.
Partner with the team to develop a detailed understanding of the business and offer mentorship or technical solutions to identify business problems.
You will work under minimal supervision and independently handle complex issues while referring only the most complex issues to higher-level staff.
Help drive the adoption of new data and analytics solutions within our businesses and coach users to analyze and access data via various data and analytics tools.
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
Minimum of four years of related work experience
Business acumen and the ability to partner and communicate effectively with business counterparts
Experience in translating business requirements into data solutions
Experience with data analytics tools and applications
Experience in extracting data from databases and other applications
Applied experience with data process mapping and business analysis
Fluent English is mandatory

Preferred Qualifications
Certification in programming language or business intelligence tools
Confirmed skills querying relational databases with query language
Confirmed experience working with large data stores
Experience with the Agile mindset

At Cargill, everyone matters and everyone counts. Cargill is committed to creating and sustaining an inclusive and diverse work environment where all employees are treated with dignity and respect. As such and in alignment with our Guiding Principles, Cargill's long-standing equal employment opportunity policy prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant based on race, ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, marital status, family status, citizenship status, veteran status, military status, union affiliation, or any other status protected by law. Cargill also complies with all applicable national and local laws and regulations pertaining to non-discrimination and employment.

required_skills: ['Microsoft Excel', 'Programação (computação)', 'Python', 'Analítica de dados', 'Big data', 'Ciência de dados', 'Indicadores-chave de desempenho', 'Microsoft PowerPoint', 'Microsoft Project', 'O&M']
description:
Sobre a vaga
If you are passionate about the world of renewable energies, you are motivated to contribute to a more sustainable world, and you want to be part of a diverse team and a vibrant culture, don't miss this opportunity to take a new step in your professional life!

What do we do?

Atlas Renewable Energy was founded by an experienced team of pioneers in developing renewable energies, with a recognized track record in the US, Latam, and Europe. Since its founding in 2017, Atlas Renewable Energy has established itself in the Americas as one of the region's fastest-growing large-scale clean energy generators.

Our approach is focused on creating tailored solutions to provide clean energy to large consumers, guaranteeing the highest level of excellence during the development, construction, and management of projects and serving as agents of change in the communities where we operate, promoting a lifestyle sustainability, diversity, and inclusion and supporting their development. Our leadership in the industry is shown through the implementation of rigorous quality controls in the execution of our projects and total transparency, as well as by our innovative character.

What are we looking for?

We are looking for a Performance Data Analyst. will be responsible for analyzing the solar plant data and proposing solutions to improve the Solar plants' reliability, performance, and availability.


What challenges will you face?

Use big data to analyze and troubleshoot low-performance issues with short and long-term impacts.
Manger and improve the KPIs of availability and performance ratio for the operating contracts.
Identify performance issues using our data analytics tools and provide feedback for their improvement
Define daily maintenance priorities.
Remotely collaborate with operations staff at the plant to fix issues with the highest efficiency possible
Lead weekly performance meetings to review fixed problems, current state, and action plans
Use big data tools to automate and improve processes that impact the operating plants


What specific knowledge do you require?

Minimum of 5 years of experience with knowledge in big data analytics and O&M preferably in the energy sector.
Bachelor of Data Science or Engineering degree
Advanced knowledge of Python programming and big data tools.
PowerPoint, Excel, Word MS Project

What does Atlas offer you?

Belong to a multicultural, inclusive, and diverse environment. We are in the USA, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Uruguay, Colombia, and Spain.
Being part of a company that promotes flexibility: work by objectives, Hybrid/flexible work style (home-office or in the office) in coordination with your supervisors.
20 work days of vacation (which you can take in advance without completing the year) and additional rest days for the end-of-the-year holidays.
Other economic benefits, such as a performance bonus and food vouchers.
We promote sports with our "In Motion" benefit,
We promote Health and Life with our health and life insurance with high-level coverage.

If you have these requirements, do you want to be part of a multinational company in the growing and innovative energy sector? Please apply

description:
Sobre a vaga
Reconhecemos e valorizamos a pluralidade dos nossos times. Por isso, criamos condições para a equidade de oportunidades através de políticas, práticas e atitudes que promovam uma cultura de respeito e o desenvolvimento de talentos.

Buscamos cada vez mais diversidade de gênero, etnias, religiões, LGBTQIA+, deficiências, culturas e histórias para impulsionar a inovação em nosso DNA.

E estamos sempre à procura de mentes inovadoras que possam contribuir com a nossa missão. Que tal fazer parte do nosso time?

Local Principal: Brazil (BR) - São Paulo - Indaiatuba

Função: Serviços Financeiros

Título: Analista de Dados JR (Business Intelligence Analyst) - Indaiatuba - 99136

Como Analista de Dados JR (Business Intelligence Analyst) na John Deere, locado em Indaiatuba- SP, você será responsável por:

Trabalhar em conjunto com o time de Operações, vislumbrando identificar e implementar oportunidades de melhoria contínua e automação, com o intuito de fornecer uma experiência mais ágil, simples e com qualidade aos times internos e clientes;
Fornecer informações e relatórios à gestão para apoiar no gerenciamento e tomada de decisão,
Avaliar riscos operacionais e pontos frágeis de nossos processos, identificando oportunidades e implementando mitigantes através de controles/ atividades automatizados(as).

Requisitos

Exigidos:

Graduação completa ou em andamento (conclusão em 2024), nas áreas de TI, Analista de dados, Ciência de dados, Administração, Engenharias, e afins;
Inglês intermediário (lê e redige e-mails com autonomia, atende ligações telefônicas pouco complexas e participa de reuniões);
Experiência com ferramentas de visualização: tableau e Power BI;
Conhecimentos de SQL, Python e/ou R;
Experiência com RPAs - "Robotic Process Automation" (Power Automate, Phyton, UiPath, Automation Anywhere e/ou Kryon).

Desejáveis

Conhecimentos e/ou experiência com Github;
Conhecimentos e/ou experiência com Databricks;
Inglês avançado (possui vocabulário amplo, boa gramática, conduz reuniões, argumenta, negocia e ministra treinamentos).

O Que Você Receberá

Na John Deere, você conseguirá desenvolver uma carreira que levará você aonde quer chegar. Além de produzirmos máquinas conectadas e inteligentes, com a mais alta qualidade, criamos soluções e serviços que garantam que nossos clientes possam gerir seus negócios de forma sustentável e produtiva. Com conexões tecnológicas, sociais e humanas, você terá liberdade de explorar novos projetos e pensar de forma inovadora.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

Job Description:

This is an exciting opportunity to work in a dynamic environment with future global projects, creating, managing and developing parts catalog data. Our primary objective is to have them available, accessible, and accurate at the time of vehicle delivery, improving quality, and helping to create the best vehicles and customer experience in the industry.

We achieve this goal by considering the customer’s needs in everything we do. If you are an exceptional professional who is willing to perform above and beyond to wow our customers and gain their lifelong loyalty, we need you on our team!

The position demands a considerable amount of energy, creativity, & drive for results initiatives.

Key Job Elements:

The primary role of the Aftersales Catalog Data Technical Analyst (Service Part Information - SPI) is to author catalog application data for Global Parts Cataloging system, ACDELCO& eCommerce data catalog, support parts change management, support Parts Readiness & Supply Chain and generate BI reports.
Analyze Parts Readiness issues and support on solutions for program launches
Promote discussion with Supply Chain in order to improve data flow to communicate parts changes to warehouse/procurement systems.
Update team database to analyze new adds and changes in Master Parts List
Determine where the parts and usages will be displayed in the catalog in order to allow the dealers to search the correct parts easily
Input catalog data in the global system ERAPA-I
Support development of the eCommerce & ACDELCO Data Catalog
Process changes in the catalog authored by the responsible engineers
Respond to dealers’ questions received by Parts Literature Call Center
Generate reports for pending tasks

Additional Job Description

Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Mechatronic or Production Engineering.
Very good knowledge of automotive systems
English Advanced (writing & speaking)
Very good written and oral communication and presentation skills in Portuguese and English
Technical drawing experience
Advanced skills in MS Office software (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and Power BI (will be a plus)
Ability to have keep the standards and to set new standards to improve dealer’s experience – Innovation
Strong ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines
High sense of urgency and customer focus
Strong Interpersonal skills

S

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Sobre a vaga
About Us

WEX is a global leader in financial technology solutions, based in Portland, Maine, United States, with over 6,000 WEXers distributed in over 40 countries. We simplify the complexities of payment systems across continents and industries like Fleet, Corporate Payments, and Benefits. We look to manage employee benefits, streamline how companies pay and get paid by suppliers, save on fuel costs, or modernize how companies manage their fleet, WEX solutions reduce the administrative burdens.


You Will Be Expected To

Have exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
Are self motivated and able to work independently with minimum supervision.
Have experience writing modern data pipelines deployed in the cloud.
Have worked on agile teams to deliver software iteratively.

We Are Looking For a Professional Who Has

Good understanding of dbt to perform data transformation tasks
Good understanding of data design principles and dimensional data modeling
Good SQL skills and understanding of query optimization strategies in Snowflake

Analytics Engineer developing complex data models using dbt, macros, and Jinja.

If you are looking for a growing career – come be part of WEX today!

description:
Sobre a vaga
Aurora is looking for a Data Analyst to join our São Paulo office

About the position
Are you looking to leverage your data skills while helping deal with the energy crisis? Based in São Paulo, as an early member of the geographically dispersed Data Team within the Software Solutions team, you will contribute to setting up processes and streamlining data pipelines that power Aurora’s energy model forecasts for countries around the world that are used by movers, shakers and policy makers in the energy industry. You will work closely with other teams at Aurora to understand data requirements, support data acquisition, QA and analysis. It is an exciting opportunity to work on several aspects of the data lifecycle while supporting the larger global energy transformation.

About us
From its academic roots, Aurora Energy Research has grown to become the largest dedicated power market analytics company in Europe, providing data-driven intelligence for strategic decisions in the global energy transformation. We are a diverse team of around 400 experts with vast energy, financial and consulting backgrounds, covering power, hydrogen, carbon and fossil commodities.

We are active in Europe, Australia and the US, working with world-leading organisations to provide comprehensive market intelligence, bespoke analytic and advisory services, and cutting-edge software. We are a thriving, rapidly growing company with offices across the globe and more opening soon. We currently serve around 600 of Europe’s most influential energy sector participants, including utilities, investors, and governments, and expect to continue to grow rapidly, adding new countries and products to our portfolio.

Key responsibilities
Liaise with Aurora teams to understand data requirements, support data acquisition from public and third-party sources, QA and analyse data.
Support development, QA and launch of Aurora dashboards to visualise the data
Support data discovery by cataloguing data and relevant metadata
Support Aurora teams on data analysis projects

What we offer
A fun, informal and international work culture
A competitive salary package
Access to regular coaching and mentoring sessions and the opportunity to learn from experienced HR professionals
Access to the Aurora Academy, our training programme offering a range of opportunities to develop your skills

At Aurora we will consider all requests for flexible working. For most roles, the following types of flexibility are usually possible: a hybrid model of remote and in-office working, part-time hours and flexible start and finish times. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility we could offer and we will explore what’s possible for the role.

The Company is committed to the principle that no employee or job applicant shall receive unfavourable treatment on grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership and pregnancy and maternity.

What we are looking for
Required attributes:
At least 1 year of experience with relational and/or columnar databases and SQL
At least 1 year of experience coding with Python and working with YAML, JSON
Familiarity with data scraping, data wrangling and QA
Hands-on experience with data analytics and visualisation tools like Power BI, Tableau, Excel
Proficiency (C1 Level) in English
Good communication skills

Desirable attributes:
Familiarity with statistical and/or AI models

Please note, the start date of the successful candidate is to be confirmed. We are currently in the process of building out the team in São Paulo so please submit your application to register your interest in this role. We will be reaching out to you as soon as possible.We will review applications as they are received. Salary will be competitive with experience.

To apply, please submit your CV, a brief cover letter, your salary expectations and state your earliest possible start date to the Apply Button above.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Country

Brazil

Job Family

Customer Success Management

For almost 90 years, GfK has been a reliable and trusted insight partner for the world’s biggest companies and leading brands who make a difference in every consumer’s life - and we will continue to build on this. We connect data, science and innovative digital research solutions to provide answers for key business questions around consumers, markets, ROI, brands and media. With our headquarters in Germany and a presence in around 60 countries worldwide, you benefit from our global company with a diverse community of 8,000+ employees.

Harnessing the power of our workforce, the greatest asset we have is our people. As part of GfK, you can take your future into your own hands. We value talent, skills and responsibility and will support your development within our international teams. We are proud of our heritage and our future, as we continue our evolution from Market Research provider to SaaS data solutions and consulting partner. We value extraordinary people and this is why we are looking for YOU to help create our future. For our employees as well as for our clients we pursue one goal: Growth from Knowledge!

Job Description

As a CSM Specialist you will have the following key accountabilities:
Be a point of support for clients clients in the durables sector supported by your manager and acting as the main point of contact for these clients.
Provide relevant insights that enable smarter business decisions and drive growth for our partners.
Assist to ensure data quality and regular report delivery, complying with the agreed standard for each client. You should also propose and execute improvements in existing processes and client reports.
Offer support and guide clients to adequately use GfK information. You will also hold training sessions for new users and present GfK’s research results on clients.
Eventually, support on new clients prospection.
Work cross functionally within the business to ensure client needs are met and questions answered.
Now that we have introduced you to the position as CSM Specialist, what skills, qualifications and experience should you, have?
A Bachelor’s degree
Strong analytical skills
Good communication skills
Ability to maintain client relationships
Client focus, eye for detail and high quality standards
Advanced level MS Office (Excel and Powerpoint)
Advanced English
We are an ethical and honest company that is wholly committed to its clients and employees. We are proud to be an inclusive workplace for all and are committed to equal employment opportunity, focusing on all of our employees reaching their full potential.

We respect and value every employee regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, personality, experience, culture, faith, socio-economic status, or physical or mental disabilities.

We endorse the core principles and rights set forth in the United Nations Declaration of Human Rights and the Social Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, promoting the universal values of human dignity, freedom, equality, and solidarity.

Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do on: https://www.gfk.com/about-gfk/diversity-and-inclusion

At GfK we work collaboratively with our colleagues but offer a flexible working approach, including dividing our time between office & remote working as well as the opportunity to flex our working hours around team core hours.

We offer an exciting work environment that brings people together. We encourage an entrepreneurial and innovative spirit and make use of the latest digital technologies. We are looking for self-starters, who accept challenges and create solutions.

Can there be a better place to take center stage in the digital revolution? We are excited to get to know you!

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Requirements

Desarrollar herramientas analíticas como apoyo a la estrategia de negocio y para impulsar la actividad de ventas y optimización del portafolio de clientes, de acuerdo con el caso específico de mejora que se necesite a lo largo de los países de Latinoamérica.

Colaborar con los equipos de negocio para integrar las estrategias en las actividades de desarrollos analíticos y sus casos de uso.

Dar seguimiento y medición a la actividad de los desarrollos analíticos para cada caso de uso.

Identificar oportunidades de mejora en el desempeño de las soluciones analíticas que se encuentran en uso.

Work Experience

Desarrollar modelos analíticos, a través del análisis de la información de los prospectos o clientes de seguros, para apoyar la estrategia de venta y conservación del portafolio

Realizar reportes de seguimiento y desempeño de los modelos analíticos, para detectar de manera temprana alertas en los resultados de las campañas

Interactuar con el equipo de negocio para establecer la estrategia de cada solución analítica, para asegurar que pueda ser implementada en el corto plazo

Identificar oportunidades de mejora a través de modelos analíticos que apoyen las estrategias de venta y conservación del portafolio de clientes

Interactuar con el sponsor para buscar la oportunidad desde el punto de vista analítico, y asegurar que la implementación sea según los estándares de Chubb.
Programación en python, R (deseable) enfocado a desarrollo de modelos de machine learning*
Manejo de bases de datos en SQL*
Conocimiento matemático-estadístico*
Excel medio-avanzado
Nivel de inglés intermedio

Tableau/Qlick Sense básico
Mínimo 2 años de experiencia en desarrollo de modelos de machine learning*

required_skills: ['Trabalho em equipe', 'Análise de inventário', 'Controle de inventário', 'Focal Point', 'Gestão de estoques', 'Gestão logística', 'Habilidades analíticas', 'Linhas de produção', 'Processos administrativos', 'Resolução de problemas']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

O analista terá a missão de planejar, analisar e controlar a produção. Será o ponto focal e o responsável pelos processos de gestão de estoque do CD.

Responsibilities and assignments

Auxiliar em analises de indicadores operacionais, buscando identificar oportunidades de melhorias.
Atuar junto a operação visando sanar/localizar inconsistências de estoque.
Realizar rotinas administrativas, cadastros, atualização de base de dados.
Realizar a gestão de giro de inventário.
Acompanhar a performance da contagem de inventário.
Suporte as áreas de atendimento a operação.


Requirements And Qualifications

Necessário

Graduação completa logística ou areas correlatas.
Disponibilidade para atuar em turnos.
Excel avançado.
Conhecimento em PBI.
Experiência prévia em inventario.


Será Diferencial

Inglês/Espanhol (intermediário)
Green Belt.
Pós graduação.


Pessoas com deficiência são bem-vindas em todas as nossas oportunidades.

Additional information

Lembrando de informar o prazo de inscrições para os candidatos internos até dia 14/03.


Localidade da trabalho: Cabreúva / SP, Modelo de trabalho: Presencial.

TRABALHE CONOSCO

Sobre a Lojas Renner

Encantar a todos é a nossa maior realização.

É por meio da nossa sólida cultura, onde Encantamento e Gente são prioridades, que nos tornamos a maior varejista de moda do Brasil. Durante os nossos 55 anos, foram muitas transformações e, hoje, somos

um ecossistema de moda e lifestyle formado pelas marcas: Renner, que tem roupas e acessórios em diferentes estilos; Camicado, empresa do segmento de casa e decoração; Youcom, especializada em moda jovem; e ASHUA Curve & Plus Size, que oferece roupas nos tamanhos 46 a 54. Atualmente, são mais de 600 lojas em operação, considerando todos os negócios. Nossa empresa ainda opera com a Realize CFI, que apoia a atividade de varejo, através da oferta e gestão de produtos financeiros.

Com 100% do nosso capital aberto na bolsa, estamos listados no Novo Mercado, grau mais elevado dentre os níveis de governança corporativa da B3. Já atuamos em todos os estados brasileiros, no Uruguai e na Argentina.

Também temos orgulho de dizer que Sustentabilidade é um dos nossos valores e por meio do Instituto Renner e de outras iniciativas, cuidamos do futuro.

O nosso ambiente de trabalho é dinâmico, onde experiência, aprendizado e inovação acontecem o tempo todo. Estamos entre as 150 melhores empresas para se trabalhar no Brasil, entre as melhores em Gestão de Pessoas e ocupamos a primeira posição entre as empresas listadas no índice da Bolsa para questões sociais, ambientais e de governança.

Nossa companhia valoriza a diversidade e atende a todos os estilos de carreira, com marcas fortes e oportunidades constantes.

required_skills: ['Capacidade de organização', 'Comunicação', 'Apresentações', 'Banco de investimento', 'Capital privado', 'Comunicação escrita', 'Comércio eletrônico', 'Marketing digital', 'Serviços de publicidade online', 'Teste A/B']
description:
Sobre a vaga
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:

Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently

It’s Great if you Have:

Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

required_skills: ['C#', 'Java', 'Programação (computação)', 'Programação orientada a objetos (POO)', 'Analítica preditiva', 'Ciência da computação', 'Ciência de dados', 'HR Screening', 'Processamento de linguagem natural (PLN)', 'Reconhecimento de padrões']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Did you know that about 10% of all insurance payouts are flowing directly into the pockets of fraudsters? The future of insurance starts with Decisions Made Better.

Shift Technology harnesses the power of AI to enable the world’s leading insurance organizations to make better decisions. Our products automate and optimize decisions from underwriting to claims, resulting in increased operational efficiency, reduced costs, and superior customer experiences for millions of people around the globe.

Our culture is built on innovation, trust, and a drive to transform the insurance industry by imagining and innovating solutions that impact insurers and their customers - like you! We come from more than 40 different countries and cultures and together we are creating the future of insurance.

The Data Science team works on a broad range of subjects. We actively participate in the definition and development of our suite of products on fraud detection, anti-money laundering and claim automation. We have a lot of technical and professional experience in data science, data engineering, coding, business understanding and client interactions. Additionally, we also work on various data types such as structured data, free text, documents and images.

What You’ll Do…

As a member of the data science team, you will be working alongside our technical experts and your role will be key to roll-out our different solutions to the clients.
Set-up and deploy in production the data processing pipelines of our clients, including data reception in batches or in real-time, data cleaning, information extraction, calibration of fraud detection models, etc.
R&D for product development and innovation (through machine learning, image analysis, NLP, trend analysis, chatbots…)
Work closely with our clients to understand their needs, their feedback to improve our solutions
Work closely with the sales team for prospects demo

What You Bring...

You have an advanced degree in Engineering or Computer Science
You are familiar with an object-oriented programming (C++, Java or C#)
You can write quality production code
You combine strong analysis with synthesis abilities and are not afraid to deal with the details
You are comfortable working with clients
You speak fluent English. Fluency in other languages is a big plus

Recruitment Process

HR screening call
CodinGame
Technical interview with Data Scientist
Last round interview with the hiring manager


I-

To support our employees at every stage of their careers and lives, we are always assessing the benefits we offer to ensure we are competitive. Here are some we’d like to highlight:

Flexible remote and hybrid working options
Competitive Salary and a variable component tied to personal and company performance
Company equity
Generous PTO and paid holidays
Parental leave opportunities
Extensive mental health benefits provided via our global Employee Assistance Program
Paid volunteering time - 16 hours annually

We offer many benefits in various countries - ask your recruiter for more information.

At Shift we strive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce. We hire and trust people without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, age, national or ethnic origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other non-merit criteria.

Shift Technology is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our application and employment process. Should you require accommodation, please email accommodation@shift-technology.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Shift Technology does not accept unsolicited CVs from recruiters or employment agencies in response to the Shift Technology Careers page or a Shift Technology social media post. Any unsolicited CVs, including those submitted directly to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Shift Technology.
