description:
Sobre a vaga
A U.S.-based company that is leveraging technology to support businesses in doubling or tripling their growth while maintaining a profit, is looking for a Data Analyst. The selected candidate will be responsible for analyzing and defining metrics that tie back to business performance and initiatives. The private equity company is combining funding with effective operational execution and results-driven go-to-market strategies to help clients achieve their goals. This will be a full-time long-term position.

Job Responsibilities:

Develop, design, and maintain various databases
Write queries to draw metrics for marketing, sales, and customer success
Use relevant data to prepare reports that can successfully communicate market trends to executive leadership
Make the company’s products more predictive and informed by conducting portfolio-level analysis of changing trends
Create documentation that can help stakeholders understand the steps of the data analysis process and replicate it if necessary

Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a Data Analyst/ Data Scientist (or other analytical roles)
Expert-level proficiency in SQL and maintained databases
Extensive experience building and maintaining Tableau (or other BI tools) dashboards
Should be curious, data-driven, and numerically inclined
Skills in project management, organization, and process management
Great English communication skills, both written and verbal
Experience with Google Cloud, Git, writing automation scripts with Python, and ETL tools will be a plus

description:
Sobre a vaga
What role will you play?

We have lots of ideas about how to successfully drive digitalization in companies. For example, with open cloud platforms, highly developed security systems, precise analytics algorithms, and clever tools for developers. What is your role in this? Move the world from behind the scenes with your IT expertise and passion for game-changing information technology. Rethink IT and steer projects in completely new directions. Be bold when others would have given up and lead one of Siemens’ key data delivery teams within the domain of “Factory Data” to bring value to our business by developing and deploying next gen solutions for the Factory Data Cloud.

As the Cloud Data Analyst you develop cloud solutions and data models on Snowflake for our customers from the domain across multiple locations to drive the Siemens’ digitalization.

You will be responsible for:

Supporting the data factory team to leverage enterprise data solutions and drive business value
Mining and analyzing data to drive efficiency and optimization, develop custom data models and algorithms, and develop processes and tools to monitor production systems and data accuracy
Identifying, creating, preparing data required for modern BI solutions using new cloud technologies
Interacting with clients, providing cloud support, and make recommendations based on client needs

We are looking for:

Experience as Cloud Data Analyst or similar role
Experience with Data Warehousing and Dimensional Data Modeling
Proficiency in SQL
Experience with ETL/ELT processes
Prior experience with Snowflake cloud based data warehouse
You have a good understanding and experience in cloud technologies(AWS Preferred)
Experience with Version control tools such as Git, GitLab
Ability to understand technical concepts and turn them into business terms
Experience working with international teams
Excellent communication and mediation skills
Business fluent English language skills (written and spoken)

Bonus Qualifications:

Experience with Financials and Sales data models
Experience in visualization technologies (e.g. Qlik, Tableau, PowerBI)
Experience with scripting languages (Python,R,Java)
Experience with data transformation tool dbt
Experience in agile methodologies (e.g. SCRUM)

#Siemens #ITMakesUsMove

Siemens is committed to creating a diverse environment and is glad to be an equal opportunity employer. We strongly encourage applications from a diverse talent pool!

description:
Sobre a vaga
A MSXI está em busca de profissionais formados em Administração, Engenharia ou áreas correlatas. Se você deseja fazer parte de um time inovador e orientado para resultados, talvez essa seja sua oportunidade. Aqui você será responsável pelo fomento comercial aos produtos e serviços da área de F&I, atuando diretamente nas concessionárias. Em sua atuação deverá interagir com os profissionais da concessionária, principalmente com Gerente de Serviços, Gerente de vendas, consultor de acessórios e diretor de operações

Qualificações Técnicas:

Conhecimento avançado em Pacote Office;
Experiência em implantação/melhoria de processos.
Experiência no setor automotivo;
Inglês intermediário;

Informações de Trabalho:

Regime de contratação: CLT
Carga horária: 40 horas semanais;
Região de atuação: Brasília

O que podemos lhe oferecer?

Remuneração fixa;
Benefícios;

Sobre a MSXI

Com aproximadamente 7.000 colaboradores presentes em mais de 80 países em todo o mundo, nossos times proporcionam liderança e expertise na indústria automotiva e suas redes de concessionários nos seguintes produtos:

Warranty & Technical
Parts & Service
Retail Performance Management
Customer Engagement
Fleet & Mobility

Construindo confiança desde 1931, nossa reputação comprova que somos o parceiro de aproximadamente todas as marcas de veículos do mercado. Nossos talentosos colaboradores nos ajudam a superar nossas ambiciosas metas ano após ano. Se você se identifica com nosso negócio, dê uma olhada em nossas oportunidades de carreira.

Como se aplicar?

Para se aplicar a esta posição, por favor acesse o link https://careers.msxi.com/ Os candidatos selecionados serão convidados a participar de uma entrevista por telefone ou presencialmente.

A MSXI é uma empresa de igualdade de oportunidades e incentiva a candidatura de pessoas qualificados, independentemente de sexo, raça, deficiência, idade, orientação sexual, gênero, religião ou crença, estado civil ou maternidade.

description:
Sobre a vaga
No Relocation Assistance Offered

# 152369 - Sao Paulo, Sao Paulo, Brazil

Do you want to be part of a team that is building a future to smile about? What about having the opportunity to connect with others across the world, full of stimulating discussions, and making impactful contributions? If this is how you see your career, Colgate is the place to be!

Our dependable household brands, dedicated employees, and sustainability commitments make us a company passionate about building a future to smile about for our employees, consumers, and surrounding communities. The pride in our brand fuels a workplace that encourages creative thinking, champions experimentation, and promotes authenticity which has contributed to our enduring success.

If you want to work for a company that lives by their values, then give your career a reason to smile...every single day.

The main objectives of the Digital Marketing Manager - CRM, are to:

Develop CP Brazil´s CRM strategy, having clear 1PD acquisition & Enrichment strategy as well as performance journeys to connect with our audiences
Link CRM journeys through the ACPL and integrate CRM plans within our Brands communication plans
Implement our CDP for better segmentation
Identify and test new digital capabilities
Align with the Regional and Global teams the ways of working and priorities for the region

What you will do

Work with Global, regional CP & agency CRM teams, as well as external partners (Blueconic, Salesforces, Media Vendors) to:

Develop and keep a CRM strategy updated, as this discipline evolves
Ensure to reach & surpass our 1PD acquisition & enrichment goals according to pre-defined business & attributes priorities.
Generate 1PD audiences to be deployed in Media activation as pure audiences, Look a Like, etc.
Provide insights, trends and recommendations from data gathered through our 1P database
Monitor and report results to all relevant stakeholders, using the success metrics defined
Train the marketing community to be more CRM savvy and perform local initiatives

Support eCommerce efforts and teams with digital media expertise, basic & advanced content development, storage and maintenance, new features in the websites, aiming at increasing exposure, sales and conversion

Provide technical support and assessment on new technologies and tools that can help accomplish the 2025 strategic digital initiatives

Bring specialized knowledge within CRM in order to upskill the commercial team to face the new challenges of a data driven, people centric and agile market & organization

This is not an exhaustive list of duties or functions.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor degree (Marketing / Business Administration)
Solid knowledge and experience in Digital Marketing with strong knowledge in 1PD acquisition and CRM
Leadership and management experience in an ever evolving digital market to build, develop and motivate people, as well as to work with multifunctional regional & local teams, outside partners and vendors
Entrepreneurial previous experience
Experience in ecommerce
Fluent English

Preferred qualifications include:

Knowledge and experience in all digital marketing disciplines (paid, owned and earned media, search, programmatic buying, martechs, mobile, data, social, CRM etc)

Equal Opportunity Employer

Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.

Are you interested in working for Colgate-Palmolive? You can apply online and attach all relevant documents such as a cover letter and resume or CV. Applications received by e-mail are not considered in the selection process. Become part of our team. We look forward to your application.

Colgate-Palmolive is a leading global consumer products company, tightly focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition. Colgate sells its products in over 200 countries and territories around the world under such internationally recognised brand names as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, Tom’s of Maine, Sorriso, Speed Stick, Lady Speed Stick, Softsoap, Irish Spring, Protex, Sanex, Elta MD, PCA Skin, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill’s Science Diet and Hill’s Prescription Diet.

For more information about Colgate’s global business, visit the Company’s web site at http://www.colgatepalmolive.com. To learn more about Colgate Bright Smiles, Bright Futures® oral health education programme, please visit http://www.colgatebsbf.com. To learn more about Hill's and the Hill’s Food, Shelter & Love program please visit http://www.hillspet.com. To learn more about Tom’s of Maine please visit http://www.tomsofmaine.com.

Reasonable accommodation during the application process is available for persons with disabilities. Please contact Application_Accommodation@colpal.com with the subject "Accommodation Request" should you require accommodation.

description:
Sobre a vaga
About Q4

At Q4, we hustle, we grind and we grow. As the team members that make up #Q4orce, we care, we compete and we support each other every day. We’re on a mission to deliver a best-in-class client experience that is driven by technology, data, and of course, our people.

Q4 is the leading capital markets access platform that is transforming how issuers, investors, and the sell-side efficiently connect, communicate, and engage with each other. We are a trusted partner to more than 2,650 public companies globally, including many of the most respected brands in the world, and we maintain an award winning culture where our team members grow and thrive. We are on our way to becoming the largest and most trusted, Investor relations platform company in the world.

We hire smart, curious, and talented people to push boundaries, reimagine what’s possible, and turn challenges into opportunities. All while keeping the needs of our clients at the heart of everything we do.

Come grow with us!

Leading the data quality control effort and enhancing quality assurance throughout the software development life cycle. Provide data governance, data quality leadership and guidance to the team. This role is an advocate and driver of Product build quality and measurements in the Development team.

Responsibilities:

Ensuring high data quality & doing data completeness validation.
Testing end-to-end experience to check for data integrity.
Conduct gap analysis, data-mapping, business process maps, flow charts, and create relevant documentation.
Ensuring effective and efficient testing practice, approach, and execution.
Ensuring quality control for all software deliverables
Supporting and elevating quality assurance standards and best practices
Ensuring documentation of all quality assurance artifacts
Providing critical insight and reports on sprint quality measurements to the team and managers, and drive retro discussions towards improvements

Tasks:

Create, maintain and execute tests targeting data completeness and integrity using sql/scripts.
Participate in all relevant sprint rituals
You will be the primary QA contact at the squad level
Conduct regular sync ups with Intern, Development Lead, and Product Owners
Onboard and offboard QA Interns; provide mentorship to the Interns
Maintain all test suites/relevant documentation for the Products
Regularly provide metrics on quality for sprints and overall Product, and drive collaborated actions towards further quality improvements
Provide reporting on defects/bugs found during sprint and measurements against metrics such as velocity/stories to the team and manager, and facilitate/drive sprint retro discussions on analyzing and improving sprint delivery quality
Undertake any other reasonable task that may be asked of you by your supervisor or senior management
Participate and drive the addressing and resolving of SUPIN issues and RCA exercises

Requirements:

Strong SQL query skills and expertise in data manipulation techniques.
Data exploration & Analysis using tools.
3+ years in quality assurance role for software development.
Strong understanding of Agile development and CI/CD
Experience using bug tracking and test case management tools (JIRA, TestRail)
Strong understanding of Quality Assurance testing methodology and processes
Strong understanding of automated testing practice in an Agile environment
Experience using various automation tools to help streamline testing (java/python)
Experience with API (JSON) and tools such as Postman
Proactive in analyzing and identifying areas to improve Product quality
Able to ensure best quality practices, effective approach, and latest tools for quality assurance
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Experience working on an agile product team
Strong written and oral communicator
Committed to continuous growth through learning

Why Q4?

We are motivated by solving complex problems in unorthodox ways. Emphasis on your well-being means you experience your true potential. We offer a variety of benefits to ensure you can always work hard and have fun:

Growth Opportunities
100% Remote work
Virtual team building and socials, keeping people connected is important to us; and
A fantastic culture to top it all off!

Join #Q4orce

Q4’s diverse and inclusive workplace fosters a friendly, open-minded environment. Diversity makes us stronger from the increased pace of innovation to strengthening our culture. With great reasons to work here, take advantage by submitting your application to join our growing team.

Q4 values diversity and people of all backgrounds and abilities. Should you require any accommodations prior to or during the interview process, please contact hr@q4inc.com .

#q4orce

position: Corporate - IT Business Analyst (SAP) - Latin America
company: {'name': 'Amcor', 'size': '+ de 10.001 funcionários', 'sector': 'Fabricação de embalagens e recipientes'}
description:
Sobre a vaga
Join Amcor and you can be part of the team that makes the packaging of the future better for people and our planet.
Here at Amcor, we work together every day to make a positive impact on the lives of millions of people across the globe by providing packaging for essential products, including food, beverages, pharmaceutical, medical, home and personal-care. We are sustainability leaders in our industry. We are the first global packaging company to commit to make all our products recyclable or reusable by 2025. Our products are vital to support the lives of millions of people across the globe every day.
We are always looking for talented and passionate individuals who are motivated to make a difference. Working at Amcor means you will have a unique opportunity to be a part of an organisation that is committed to innovating and driving new solutions to create more sustainable packaging solutions.
To find out more about our commitment to sustainability and about Amcor, visit www.amcor.com I LinkedIn I Glassdoor I Facebook I Twitter I YouTube

About The Role
The IT Business Analyst (SAP) is responsible for the MES (Manufacturing Execution Systems) and for the ERP, in partnership with other IT colleagues and external suppliers. This role will primary focus on SAP MII and will be responsible for supporting on the SAP ERP, especially on the Finance and Controlling.
The IT Business Analyst will participate in implementation projects, enhancements and maintenance activities. The role is also responsible for other Business Applications used by Amcor Mexico, such as electronic billing, payroll, S&OP.

Key Job Accountabilities
Regular Support Activities
Support SAP environments and integrated Applications for Mexico, in partnership with IT colleagues and suppliers. Strong focus on SAP MII
Analyzing business requirements and processes and recommending them to the management and executives for implementation
Creating and maintaining documentation that includes the design, requirements, and user manuals for the organization
Identifying the development needs for the purpose of streamlining and improving the operations of the organization for efficiency and profitability
Project Activities
Partners with business teams to plan and implement/lead projects related to Business Applications, with focus on SAP MII and SAP ERP
Documents business requirements and translates them into functional requirements and IT solution designs
Works with development resources to confirm the requirement is being met
Build test plans, conducts component/integration testing and participates/supports on user acceptance tests
Assists with data conversion and data validation
Participates in go-live activities and post go-live support
Supports knowledge sharing and knowledge transfer to IT colleagues and end users
Apply the Amcor Project Management Methodology with accountability for milestones while engaging and/or leading appropriate project team members (IT and Business)
Responsible for defining project requirements, project scope, timeline, resources, obtaining Business and IT agreement on these items prior to project start

Qualifications/Requirements
Bachelor’s degree, in computer science, management information systems or a related field or equivalent experience
3 - 5+ years of work experience in SAP systems
Experience in a global environment desirable
SAP MII (solution for shopfloor) and its integration with SAP ERP
General knowledge of SAP ERP, especially in the modules FICO, MM, PP and SD
Advanced English and Spanish communication level (spoken, written); other languages (Portuguese) will be considered an advantage
Agility, sound judgment, independent thinking, follow-through and initiative
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Focus on continuous improvement and business processes
Effective communications skills
Ability to effectively work cross-functionally and able to demonstrate facilitation skills in a global environment
Good organizational skills and the ability to work well both independently and as a member of a team
Amcor is a global leader in developing and producing responsible packaging solutions for food, beverage, pharmaceutical, medical, home and personal-care, and other products. Amcor works with leading companies around the world to protect their products and the people who rely on them, differentiate brands, and improve supply chains through a range of flexible and rigid packaging, specialty cartons, closures, and services. The company is focused on making packaging that is increasingly lighter weight, recyclable and reusable, and made using an increasing amount of recycled content. In fiscal year 2022, 44,000 Amcor people generated $15 billion in annual sales from operations that span 220 locations in 43 countries. NYSE: AMCR; ASX: AMC
At Amcor we believe in talent through diversity and promote equal opportunity in the workplace and recognise that discrimination and harassment of co-workers based on race, creed, disability, gender, marital or maternity status, religious or political beliefs, age or sexual orientation is unlawful.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Location : BAL - SÃO PAULO CORPORATIVO

City : São Paulo, Brasil

State : São Paulo (BR-SP)

Country : Brazil (BR)

Requisition Number : 26352

Bunge has an exciting opportunity available for a Data Scientist. In this role you will be part of a global team working on challenging, meaningful projects impacting core business activities.

Since 1818, Bunge has been connecting farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed, and fuel to the world. Looking to the future, our ambition is to continuously reinvent ourselves, leveraging data to be at the forefront of analytics, technology and talent to accomplish our purpose in a better, faster and simpler way. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world – creating world class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed.

At Bunge, people don’t just come here to work, they come here to grow – solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers. Most importantly, in all we do we live our values:

Act as One Team by fostering inclusion, collaboration, and respect
Drive for Excellence by being agile, innovative and efficient
Do What's Right by acting safely, ethically, and sustainably

Overview:

The Data Scientist applies strong expertise in machine learning, data mining, and information retrieval to design, prototype, and build next generation advanced analytics engine and services. The data scientist collaborates with translators to define technical problem statement and hypothesis to test; develops efficient and accurate analytical models that mimic business decisions

Responsibilities:

Design, create, test and implement complex models and algorithms that drive analytical solutions throughout the organization
Conduct advanced statistical and other analysis to provide actionable insights, identify trends, and measure performance.
Collaborate with translators and understands business problems to implement scalable and sustainable solutions
Coordinate with MIS, Digital Specialists, and Data Engineers to deliver holistic analytical solutions
Support translators in communicating the design, functioning and output of the analytical models/solutions developed
Ensure timely analysis and testing for regular maintenance of solutions over time

Qualifications/Requirements:

MS/PhD(Computer Science or Electronics), or MS in Computer Applications, Economics, Statistics or Mathematics or related technical discipline
2-3 years’ experience in a statistical and/or data science / business intelligence role
Should have experience in machine learning, statistics, optimization or related fields; deeper experience in working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization or distributed computing tools is a plus
Experience with programming is required; specific experience in R or Python is a plus
Experience of working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization and distributed computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop,
Hive, Spark, etc.) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies
Openness to working in Agile environments with multiple stakeholders
Professional attitude and service orientation; team player
Good verbal and written communication skills
Quick learner to business needs and translate them into potential analytics solutions
Strong work ethic; ability to work at an abstract level and gain consensus
Able to build a sense of trust and rapport that creates a comfortable and effective workplace Attitude to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Open minded to new approaches of learning

Hybrid work - Gaspar - Santa Catarina or São Paulo - SP

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. description:
Sobre a vaga
Location : BAL - SÃO PAULO CORPORATIVO

City : São Paulo, Brasil

State : São Paulo (BR-SP)

Country : Brazil (BR)

Requisition Number : 26352

Bunge has an exciting opportunity available for a Data Scientist. In this role you will be part of a global team working on challenging, meaningful projects impacting core business activities.

Since 1818, Bunge has been connecting farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed, and fuel to the world. Looking to the future, our ambition is to continuously reinvent ourselves, leveraging data to be at the forefront of analytics, technology and talent to accomplish our purpose in a better, faster and simpler way. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world – creating world class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed.

At Bunge, people don’t just come here to work, they come here to grow – solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers. Most importantly, in all we do we live our values:

Act as One Team by fostering inclusion, collaboration, and respect
Drive for Excellence by being agile, innovative and efficient
Do What's Right by acting safely, ethically, and sustainably

Overview:

The Data Scientist applies strong expertise in machine learning, data mining, and information retrieval to design, prototype, and build next generation advanced analytics engine and services. The data scientist collaborates with translators to define technical problem statement and hypothesis to test; develops efficient and accurate analytical models that mimic business decisions

Responsibilities:

Design, create, test and implement complex models and algorithms that drive analytical solutions throughout the organization
Conduct advanced statistical and other analysis to provide actionable insights, identify trends, and measure performance.
Collaborate with translators and understands business problems to implement scalable and sustainable solutions
Coordinate with MIS, Digital Specialists, and Data Engineers to deliver holistic analytical solutions
Support translators in communicating the design, functioning and output of the analytical models/solutions developed
Ensure timely analysis and testing for regular maintenance of solutions over time

Qualifications/Requirements:

MS/PhD(Computer Science or Electronics), or MS in Computer Applications, Economics, Statistics or Mathematics or related technical discipline
2-3 years’ experience in a statistical and/or data science / business intelligence role
Should have experience in machine learning, statistics, optimization or related fields; deeper experience in working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization or distributed computing tools is a plus
Experience with programming is required; specific experience in R or Python is a plus
Experience of working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization and distributed computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop,
Hive, Spark, etc.) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies
Openness to working in Agile environments with multiple stakeholders
Professional attitude and service orientation; team player
Good verbal and written communication skills
Quick learner to business needs and translate them into potential analytics solutions
Strong work ethic; ability to work at an abstract level and gain consensus
Able to build a sense of trust and rapport that creates a comfortable and effective workplace Attitude to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Open minded to new approaches of learning

Sobre a vaga
Você quer desempenhar um papel essencial na construção de um futuro melhor, trabalhando em projetos que possuem impacto na sociedade e no meio ambiente?

Está interessado(a) em buscar por soluções revolucionárias que maximizem a criação de valor?

Então junte-se à nossa equipe e venha construir o futuro na Siemens!

Falar em Siemens no Brasil é falar em fazer o que importa para a sociedade 👥

Com mais de 100 anos de atuação no país, a empresa transforma sua excelência em eletrificação, automação e digitalização em soluções para romper fronteiras e levar a engenhosidade a todos os brasileiros 🚀

Quer fazer parte desse time?

Veja nossa oportunidade de Analista de Controladoria Júnior para o time da Siemens, compartilha ou se inscreva 👏

Você será responsável por:

Analisar e subsidiar as áreas com informações sobre a performance econômica do negócio (vendas, custos, lucro e fluxo de caixa), consolidar e identificar desvios relacionados ao planejado;
Rotinas de fechamentos mensais (hedge, provisões, fundo de ajuste, alocações);
Atendimento de auditoria externa e interna.

O que precisamos de você:

Graduação completa em Administração, Contabilidade, Finanças ou afins;
Experiência na área de controladoria, contabilidade, finanças ou correlatas;
Conhecimento avançado em Excel e ferramentas de BI;
Desejável Inglês avançado;
Conhecimentos em ferramentas de Low Coding (ex: Mendix), Tratamento de Dados (ex: Alteryx, Knime) e programação (ex: Python) serão um diferencial.

Se você se identifica com o que estamos procurando, venha se aplicar!

Equipes diversificadas são equipes melhores! Se todos pensarmos da mesma forma, a inovação dificilmente acontece. Por isso, buscamos talentos de diferentes origens, gêneros, idades, raças, orientação sexual e pessoas com deficiência. Na Siemens, as oportunidades são para todos.

💰 Pacote de benefícios robusto: participação nos resultados, Assistência Médica, Assistência Odontológica, Seguro de Vida, Convênio Farmácia, Auxílio Óptico, Complemento para Auxílio-Doença, Refeição, Previdência Privada, Estacionamento, Vale Transporte, Gympass, Cartão Boas Festas, Cartão Brinquedo, Programa de Apoio ao Funcionário (EAP), Celebração por aniversário de empresa, Licença maternidade estendida, Licença paternidade estendida, Licença parental, Auxílio creche ou babá, Programa de Compra de Ações, entre outros.

Venha conosco construir o futuro! Faça parte do nosso time!

description:
Sobre a vaga
Descrição da postagem

Analista de Operações de Benefícios - Curitiba

Você prospera em um ambiente de ritmo acelerado, onde sua entrada e experiência são levadas em consideração? As palavras “dinâmico” e “inovador” animam seus ouvidos? Se você respondeu “SIM!”, este pode ser o próximo passo em sua carreira como Analista de Operações de Benefícios!

Está é uma posição presencial para a cidade de Curitiba para atuar dentro de um cliente parceiro Aon.

Aon está no negócio das melhores soluções

Na Aon, nos moldamos as decisões para melhor proteger e enriquecer a vida das pessoas ao redor do mundo.

Como uma organização, nós somos unidos pela confiança como um time diverso e inclusivo, e nós somos apaixonados por ajudar nossos colegas e clientes terem sucesso.

Como será seu dia a dia

Você atuará dentro do cliente, sendo responsável por fazer o atendimento presencial aos colaboradores parceiros, passando uma orientação geral dos planos de benefícios para eles e realizando a linha de processos operacionais que consistem em:

Atendimento diário das solicitações;
Relatórios para o cliente;
Processo de movimentação cadastral com inclusão, exclusão, upgrade ou downgrade dos benefícios adquiridos pelo cliente;
Processo de Bate Cadastral

Qual o diferencial desta atividade

Nesta posição você poderá trazer todo seu conhecimento para melhorar a qualidade do atendimento de nossos clientes, além de fazer parte de uma empresa dinâmica e que valoriza seu funcionário e busca crescer junto com o mesmo.

Habilidades e experiência que te levará ao sucesso

Excel avançado;
Experiência prévia trabalhando com benefícios;
Já ter atuado com atendimento ao cliente;
Ser resiliente para trabalhar em ambiente com alta demanda.

Como nós apoiamos nossos colegas

Além de nosso abrangente pacote de benefícios, incentivamos uma força de trabalho diversa. Além disso, nosso ambiente ágil e inclusivo permite que você gerencie seu bem-estar e equilibre vida pessoal e trabalho, garantindo que você possa ser o melhor de si na Aon. Além disso, todos os colegas desfrutam de dois “Dias Globais de Bem-Estar” a cada ano, incentivando você a dedicar um tempo para se concentrar em si mesmo. Oferecemos uma variedade de soluções de estilo de trabalho, mas também reconhecemos que a flexibilidade vai além do local de trabalho... e somos todos a favor. Chamamos isso de Smart Working!

Nossa cultura de aprendizado contínuo busca te dar as ferramentas e o inspirar a aprender, compartilhar e crescer, ajudando a atingir seu máximo potencial. Como resultado, na Aon, você é mais conectado, mais relevante e mais valorizado.

Nós oferecemos aos indivíduos com deficiência as acomodações necessárias para participar de nosso processo de aplicação ou entrevista, e para performar funções essenciais do trabalho, e para receber outros benefícios e privilégios de trabalho de acordo com o previsto em lei. Por favor nos contate e peça suas acomodações em ReasonableAdjustments@Aon.com

required_skills: ['Banco de dados', 'Comunicação', 'Analítica', 'Clientes internos', 'Habilidades analíticas', 'Observação', 'Segurança alimentar', 'Suporte administrativo', 'Suporte ao cliente', 'Testes de produto']
description:
Sobre a vaga
PROPÓSITO E IMPACTO DO TRABALHO

A (O) Analista de FSQR JR. completará testes analíticos e laboratoriais de rotina em apoio à qualidade da segurança alimentar e equipes operacionais. Estamos procurando uma pessoa trabalhadora que realize a análise de rotina dos testes de produtos, sendo responsável por verificar e monitorar o desempenho da instrumentação e realizar testes para os quais vamos fornecer supervisão intermediária. Nesta função, você documentará os resultados em bancos de dados e/ou resultados de testes de comunicação.

PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES
Realizar inspeções quantitativas e qualitativas rotineiras e testes laboratoriais sobre matérias-primas, produtos em processo e finais de forma independente, apoiando ensaios e experimentos mais complexos sob supervisão intermediária.
Garantir programas de conformidade para todos os testes individuais, o que inclui o monitoramento da adesão às normas e outras conformidades processuais de segurança alimentar.
Interpretar e documentar resultados de testes em bancos de dados ativos e comunicar resultados aos clientes internos conforme necessário.
Execute verificações de calibração, tarefas de manutenção preventiva e reparo simples à instrumentação analítica, mantendo as especificações do cliente em dia.
Ajude a desenvolver a segurança alimentar/alimentação, a qualidade e a cultura regulatória colaborando interfuncionalmente para construir, manter e melhorar uma cultura eficaz de segurança alimentar, qualidade e regulação.
Lidar com questões de suporte administrativo, técnico ou de suporte ao cliente moderadamente complexas sob supervisão geral, ao mesmo tempo em que agrava questões mais complexas para a equipe apropriada.
Outros deveres como atribuídos.

REQUISITOS
Técnico, tecnólogo ou superior completo em áreas afins;
Estar ativo no conselho específico de sua atuação CRQ;
Pacote office intermediário;
SAP diferencial.
observação: contratação para período de Safra (06/23 a 10/23).

A Cargill encoraja a vacinação contra a Covid-19 mas não obriga neste momento. Durante o processo admissional, você será questionado sobre seu status de vacinação, e se não for vacinado ou preferir não informar, é esperado que você siga protocolos específicos para empregado(as) não vacinados (exemplo: uso obrigatório de máscara, distanciamento social, restrição de acesso às instalações, etc).

Na Cargill, todas as pessoas são importantes. A Cargill está comprometida em criar e manter um ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e diversificado, onde todos e todas são tratados com dignidade e respeito. Alinhada com nossos Princípios e Valores, a Cargill proíbe qualquer tipo de discriminação e assédio contra qualquer pessoa ou candidato (a) no que diz respeito a: raça, etnia, cor, religião, nacionalidade, ascendência, sexo, gênero, identidade de gênero, expressão de gênero, orientação sexual, idade, deficiência, gravidez, informações genéticas, estado civil, status familiar, país de origem, afiliação a sindicato ou qualquer outro status protegido por lei. A Cargill também cumpre todas as leis e regulamentos nacionais e locais aplicáveis, relativos à não discriminação e empregabilidade.

description:
Sobre a vaga
An NYSE-listed company that has established themselves as the pioneers in the pharmaceutical industry is looking for a Data Analyst. The selected candidate will be providing expert input in data mining techniques and data analysis. The company has been operating for over a century and is engaged in the development, production, and distribution of a variety of healthcare-related items. This is a rare opportunity for developers who are eager to build a lucrative career and work with a multinational corporation.

Job Responsibilities:

Develop a decision support system for strategic capacity management in medical devices
Perform model enhancements using python coding and mathematical programming
Write and maintain elaborate documentation for the application
Throughout the production infrastructure, assist or take the lead in incident response, diagnosis, and follow-up on system outages and alerts
Perform scenario data analyses to identify bugs in the development of the application

Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a Data Analyst
Extensive experience working with Power BI and Python
Strong understanding of Power Query
In-depth supply chain knowledge
Fluent in conversational and written English

description:
Sobre a vaga
A U.S.-based organization that is committed to offering excellent healthcare, research, and medical education services, is looking for a Clinical Data Programmer. The selected candidate will be responsible for creating policies and ideal practices for putting data standards into effect. The non-profit organization is fostering ground-breaking discoveries that will contribute to enhancing human health on a global scale. This position requires at least 4 hours of overlap with the EST time zone. The company has managed to securely raise more than $7.6mn in funding so far.

Job Responsibilities:

Assist in the creation of strategic plans for upcoming initiatives and facilities, and provide advice on best practices for database management
Develop the report specifications in collaboration with the research study team
Create, program, and evaluate clinical data reports for assigned trials and projects, including listings, summary tables, and graphics
Create data extraction software or procedures for transferring data to authorized organizations or people
Assemble several data sources into one database or dataset
Enforce adherence to the rules and guidelines for data management and data systems that apply both internally and externally, such as good clinical practice (GCP), Food and Drug Administration (FDA), and organizational standard operating procedures (SOPs)
Construct standard and ad hoc query reports for project management and data integrity monitoring

Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a data programmer
Demonstrable experience working with Data Extraction and Reporting Services
Prior experience in the pharmaceutical and biotech industry is desirable
Excellent English communication skills, both spoken and written

description:
Sobre a vaga
Description

Consultor(a) Pleno | Engenheiro(a) de Dados | São Paulo

Você na Deloitte

Na Deloitte, buscamos pessoas que queiram gerar impactos positivos todos os dias. Impulsionamos talentos para que possam se desenvolver em um ambiente colaborativo, com times diversos e que tragam energia, empoderamento, interação e conexões. O nosso crescimento é exponencial porque os talentos que recrutamos possuem os nossos valores em suas essências. Liderar o caminho, fomentar a inclusão, colaborar para mensurar impactos, servir com integridade e cuidar uns dos outros são pontos essenciais e inegociáveis para fortalecer ainda mais o nosso propósito.

Você terá a oportunidade de evoluir sua carreira na maior empresa de serviços profissionais do mundo como Consultor(a) no time da Consultoria Empresarial, em Analytics, aqui você terá a oportunidade de ser o protagonista de sua carreira, e de gerar impactos e transformações positivas em seu redor. Na sua rotina, você irá:

Trabalhar, de forma colaborativa, com arquitetos e cientistas de dados no entendimento das necessidades de dados e na construção de aplicações em analytics e inteligência artificial;
Atuar com engenharia de dados para projetos de Modernização de Dados em diversas indústrias;
Desenvolver e implementar pipeline de dados em diversas ferramentas e repositórios;
Engajar e cooperar com equipes multifuncionais no modelo Agile, participando das cerimônias e artefatos que competem ao seu trabalho;
Realizar modelagem de dados relacionais e não-relacionais;
Trabalhar em multi plataformas;
Realizar estimativas de esforço de desenvolvimento e report a gerencia do projeto.

Acordamos todos os dias para conectar pessoas, tecnologias e ideias, que vão construir e entregar soluções para os desafios das maiores empresas do Brasil e do planeta.

Esta é uma vaga afirmativa para 50+! Acreditamos no impacto positivo causado por meio da pluralidade, não só para a Deloitte, mas para a sociedade como um todo.

Acreditamos na força dos talentos que preparamos. Eles transformam de fato, impactam organizações, impulsionam mais talentos e criam oportunidades. Que tal fazer parte da maior organização de serviços profissionais do mundo?

Requirements

O que precisa para você se candidatar à vaga?

Graduação e/ou pós-graduação completa em Matemática, Estatística, Engenharia, Engenharia de Computação ou Sistemas, Tecnologia da Informação, Computação e áreas a fins;
Inglês Intermediário;
Vivência completa com SQL, PySpark e Tableau;
Experiência com desenvolvimento em Python;

Desejável:

required_skills: ['Análise de dados', 'Desenvolvimento de algoritmo', 'Automação de processos', 'Capacidade analítica', 'Conceitos estatísticos', 'Ferramentas de gerenciamento de riscos', 'Modelagem estatística', 'Processamento de linguagem natural (PLN)', 'Repositórios', 'Resolução de problemas']

['Análise de dados', 'Comunicação', 'Ciência de dados', 'Equipes multidisciplinares', 'Estatística', 'Insights de negócios', 'Resolução de problemas', 'Soluções de pagamento', 'Suporte analítico', 'Visualização de dados']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Como Analista de Dados, você será responsável por coletar, analisar e interpretar dados de serviços financeiros, de meios de pagamento e operacionais para fornecer insights valiosos e orientar as decisões estratégicas da empresa. Sua capacidade de compreender os desafios e as nuances do setor de banking será fundamental para oferecer soluções eficazes e impulsionar o crescimento da organização.

SOBRE A CONTA AZUL

A Conta Azul é movida pela crença que todo empreendedor merece ter sucesso. Apesar do dia a dia cheio de responsabilidades, queremos que todo dono de um pequeno negócio consiga tempo para se dedicar ao que sempre sonhou quando decidiu abrir uma empresa. Por isso, usamos a tecnologia para criar uma plataforma em nuvem, onde o empreendedor juntamente com o seu contador, de forma simples e fácil, podem encontrar tudo o que precisam em tempo real. Buscamos pessoas motivadas neste propósito. Se você é esta pessoa, junte-se a nós!

SOBRE O TIME

Somos unidos pela paixão por desvendar os segredos e evidências nos dados e transformá-los em insights poderosos. Mas nosso espírito vai além disso. Valorizamos e celebramos a diversidade que existe entre nós. Exploramos os limites do conhecimento, descobrindo padrões ocultos e impulsionando o crescimento da organização.

Responsabilidades e atribuições
Coletar, limpar e validar dados financeiros provenientes de várias fontes, como transações, contas e plataformas de pagamento, garantindo a qualidade e a integridade dos dados.
Realizar análises exploratórias para identificar padrões, tendências e anomalias nos dados financeiros e operacionais, fornecendo insights relevantes para a equipe de liderança e outras partes interessadas.
Trabalhar em colaboração com a equipe de desenvolvimento de produtos para identificar oportunidades de melhoria e novas funcionalidades com base nas análises de dados.
Construir painéis interativos e relatórios personalizados para visualização de dados, utilizando Looker e Metabase .
Fornecer suporte analítico para projetos estratégicos, como desenvolvimento de novos produtos e tomada de decisões de investimento.
Identificar e monitorar indicadores-chave de desempenho (KPIs) relevantes para o negócio e propor ações corretivas ou otimizações com base nos resultados analíticos.
Colaborar com equipes multidisciplinares, incluindo C-Levels, desenvolvedores, cientistas de dados e profissionais de produto.
Acompanhar as tendências e os avanços no setor de fintech, banking e serviços financeiros compartilhando conhecimentos e implementando melhores práticas relacionadas à análise de dados e conformidade

Requisitos e qualificações
Bacharelado em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia, Estatística, Matemática ou área relacionada.
Experiência comprovada como Analista de Dados preferencialmente em fintechs, instituições financeira ou instituições de pagamento, com conhecimento dos desafios e das nuances do setor.
Experiência na coleta, limpeza e análise de grandes volumes de dados, utilizando ferramentas como SQL, Python, R ou outras linguagens de programação relevantes.
Familiaridade com plataformas e ferramentas de visualização de dados, como Looker, Tableau, Power BI ou outras soluções similares.
Habilidades de comunicação e apresentação sólidas, com a capacidade de transmitir resultados analíticos complexos de forma clara e concisa.
Pensamento analítico, habilidades de resolução de problemas e atenção aos detalhes.
Capacidade de trabalhar de forma colaborativa em equipes multidisciplinares e adaptar-se a um ambiente de trabalho dinâmico.
Desejável conhecimento das regulamentações e normas relevantes do setor de fintech, como proteção de dados e conformidade regulatória.

Informações adicionais

BENEFÍCIOS
Plano de saúde com cobertura nacional, sem desconto de mensalidade ou coparticipação para os Azuis, extensivo para dependentes (filhos e todos os cônjuges, inclusive de pessoas homoafetivas);
Plano odontológico com cobertura nacional, sem descontos em folha para titular e dependente;
Benefício flexível: R$ 1.000,00 para distribuir entre educação (Conta Azul reembolsa 70% da mensalidade), idioma (70% da mensalidade) atividades físicas e reembolso referente aos seguintes profissionais: psicólogos(as), nutricionistas, massoterapeutas e fisioterapeutas (50% do custo);
Auxílio creche para filhos (de 0 a 24 meses) de colaboradores independente de gênero;
Pulpa: App para guardar dinheiro para o futuro dos filhos (até 10 anos) dos colaboradores. Você guarda R$ 50 e a Conta Azul mais R$ 50
Auxílio Home Office mensal R$ 150,00 sem desconto
Auxílio Home Office parcela única de R$ 1.500,00 para custear a estação de trabalho
Cartão Flash de vale refeição e alimentação mensal sem desconto
Zenklub: quantas sessões quiser com Psicólogos, Psicanalistas, Terapeutas e Coaches por R$ 20,00 cada
Programa de bônus conforme atingimento de metas
Benefício Farmácia: App Vidalink com subsídio de 75% para medicamentos com receita para todos os colaboradores e dependentes com repasse integral
Licença maternidade e paternidade estendidas
Baby Blue Time: No retorno das licenças Paternidade ou Maternidade, o Azul terá direito pelos próximos 6 meses de ter a jornada reduzida em 1 hora por dia e que podem ser acumulados dentro da semana
Seguro de vida

E mais:
Ambiente inovador que proporciona crescimento, com profissionais incríveis e de aprendizado constante
Escritório com acessibilidade, que estimula a criatividade e produtividade, com comida e bebida à vontade
Horário flexível (trabalhamos de segunda a sexta)
Days Off Experience: Todos os Azuis com mais de 1 ano de casa poderão ter 4 folgas no ano
Licença gratuita na plataforma Conta Azul.

A Conta Azul é uma empresa que valoriza a inclusão: todas as nossas vagas estão abertas a pessoas com deficiência.

Por dentro da Conta Azul:

Nossos times adoram compartilhar conhecimento. Veja o que estamos fazendo por aqui.

Acesse:

https://medium.com/cultura-contaazul

https://medium.com/design-contaazul

https://engineering.contaazul.com

description:
Sobre a vaga
Job Description

Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) es una compañía global de ropa de estilo de vida con una cartera de algunas de las marcas de mezclilla más icónicas del mundo: Wrangler® y Lee®. Diseñamos, fabricamos y distribuimos productos superiores de alta calidad que se ven bien, se ajustan bien y están diseñados con sensibilidad a nuestro planeta para brindar a las personas de todo el mundo la libertad y la confianza para expresarse.

Nuestra comunidad global de más de 17,000 empleados fomenta una cultura de integridad, colaboración, desempeño y espíritu emprendedor. Buscamos empleados inclusivos, humildes, creativos y con visión de futuro con una pasión por crear productos de ropa innovadores, accesorios y soluciones que sean significativos y con propósito para los consumidores y empleados.

Localidad: Ciudad de México

Puesto: Programador Analista

Educación / Conocimientos
Ingeniero en sistemas (o afín)
2 años de experiencia en posición similar
Idioma inglés nivel intermedio - avanzado (se hará prueba en entrevista)
Conocimiento de algún ERP (deseable)
C#.Net (Avanzado)
Windows Forms
Desarrollo en SQL (Creación de Store procedures, Jobs, etc)
Creación y lectura de XML’s
Manejo básico de conexiones SFTP y FTP
Programación Web (Básica)
Principales responsabilidades del puesto

Proporcionar a los usuarios soporte y mantenimiento a través del chat y/o vía telefónica a las aplicaciones existentes. Diseño y desarrollo de nuevas aplicaciones periféricas a SAP, siguiendo la metodología existente. Soporte y mantenimiento a interfaces. Analisis de áreas de oportunidad en las aplicaciones existentes.

Zona de trabajo: Lomas Altas

Prestaciones superiores a las de la ley.

required_skills: ['Ambiente ágil', 'Análise de sistemas', 'Análise de sistemas de negócios', 'Diversidade', 'Gestão de relacionamentos empresariais', 'Melhoria de processos', 'Metodologias Agile', 'Modelagem de dados', 'Sistemas de negócios', 'Visualização de dados']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Build something new with a world-class team.

At Genesys, we allow our employees to make their mark by entrusting them to make decisions and do what they’ve been hired to do: their very best. Your potential is waiting; why are you?

Job Description

Genesys is looking for a highly driven Business Systems Analyst to join our Chief Data and Analytics Officer team as a member of our customer facing team. This is a unique position which requires deep business and technical expertise coupled with the ability to solve problems creatively and effectively. As a Business Systems Analyst, you will go deep into one or more areas of our business and partner with those stakeholders to assess business outcome requirements, analyze their data insights needs and challenges, identify process improvement and automation opportunities, propose business and system architectures, initiate proofs of concept efforts for specific outcomes and capabilities, develop a backlog of epics and stories, and work closely with the development teams to deliver analytical product(s).

The role of a Business Systems Analyst will have responsibility for providing business, functional, and technical expertise in identifying, evaluating, and implementing process, data, and functional solutions through data insights that support business outcomes that enable our partners to achieve their strategic objectives and grow the business.

What you'll get to do:

The primary responsibilities for this role include (but are not limited to):

Work in an agile environment, providing leadership to a team of technologists, constantly delivering and iterating on analytical solutions.
Going beyond relationship management, you’ll embed yourself into a customer facing business area, be a trusted partner, help them set analytical priorities and provide progress updates on our team commitments to those business stakeholders and our leadership
Use your business sense and process knowledge to evaluate things holistically and think through the objectives, impacts, best practices, tradeoffs, and what will be most impactful and scalable to determine the best analytical solution to support the business.
Use your excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively collaborate with a diverse group of people, to tease out and document business requirements and outcomes

Your experience should include:

5+ years of experience in, analytics, business intelligence, data architecture, including data modeling (logical & physical), data visualization, data warehousing, and analytical enablement
5+ years of business experience, with demonstrated project management, product management or managerial skills
5+ years of experience reviewing and writing technical & business requirements in relation to insights, effective data visualization, data management, metrics/KPIs or software development projects
5+ years of experience in marketing, finance, operational, or management reporting as a business systems analyst
Strong knowledge of project & program management techniques and tools as well as product owner experience (Agile/Scrum Master/Product Owner certification preferred, experience with Jira preferred).
Strong empathy for customers and the ability to think and design from the customers perspective with a strong ability to find the 80/20 solution when necessary
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Desirable Qualifications Skills:

Bachelor’s degree in the field of business, computer science or similar area or equivalent work experience
Salesforce or other CRM experience
PMP or equivalent

About Genesys:

Every year, Genesys orchestrates billions of remarkable customer experiences for organizations in more than 100 countries. Through the power of our cloud, digital and AI technologies, organizations can realize Experience as a Service™ our vision for empathetic customer experiences at scale. With Genesys, organizations have the power to deliver proactive, predictive, and hyper personalized experiences to deepen their customer connection across every marketing, sales, and service moment on any channel, while also improving employee productivity and engagement. By transforming back-office technology to a modern revenue velocity engine Genesys enables true intimacy at scale to foster customer trust and loyalty. Visit www.genesys.com.

Reasonable Accommodations:

If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you or someone you know may complete the Reasonable Accommodations Form for assistance. Please use the Candidate field in the dropdown menu to ensure a timely response.

This form is designed to assist job seekers who seek reasonable accommodation for the application process. Submissions entered for non-accommodation-related issues, such as following up on an application or submitting a resume, may not receive a response.

Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, national origin, genetics, disability, military and veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Please note that recruiters will never ask for sensitive personal or financial information during the application phase.

required_skills: ['Capacidade de organização', 'Comunicação', 'ERP (Planejamento de recursos empresariais)', 'Habilidades analíticas', 'Inglês', 'Processos empresariais', 'Produtos SAP', 'Resolução de problemas', 'SAP ERP', 'SAP MII']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Join Amcor and you can be part of the team that makes the packaging of the future better for people and our planet.
Here at Amcor, we work together every day to make a positive impact on the lives of millions of people across the globe by providing packaging for essential products, including food, beverages, pharmaceutical, medical, home and personal-care. We are sustainability leaders in our industry. We are the first global packaging company to commit to make all our products recyclable or reusable by 2025. Our products are vital to support the lives of millions of people across the globe every day.
We are always looking for talented and passionate individuals who are motivated to make a difference. Working at Amcor means you will have a unique opportunity to be a part of an organisation that is committed to innovating and driving new solutions to create more sustainable packaging solutions.
To find out more about our commitment to sustainability and about Amcor, visit www.amcor.com I LinkedIn I Glassdoor I Facebook I Twitter I YouTube

About The Role
The IT Business Analyst (SAP) is responsible for the MES (Manufacturing Execution Systems) and for the ERP, in partnership with other IT colleagues and external suppliers. This role will primary focus on SAP MII and will be responsible for supporting on the SAP ERP, especially on the Finance and Controlling.
The IT Business Analyst will participate in implementation projects, enhancements and maintenance activities. The role is also responsible for other Business Applications used by Amcor Mexico, such as electronic billing, payroll, S&OP.

Key Job Accountabilities
Regular Support Activities
Support SAP environments and integrated Applications for Mexico, in partnership with IT colleagues and suppliers. Strong focus on SAP MII
Analyzing business requirements and processes and recommending them to the management and executives for implementation
Creating and maintaining documentation that includes the design, requirements, and user manuals for the organization
Identifying the development needs for the purpose of streamlining and improving the operations of the organization for efficiency and profitability
Project Activities
Partners with business teams to plan and implement/lead projects related to Business Applications, with focus on SAP MII and SAP ERP
Documents business requirements and translates them into functional requirements and IT solution designs
Works with development resources to confirm the requirement is being met
Build test plans, conducts component/integration testing and participates/supports on user acceptance tests
Assists with data conversion and data validation
Participates in go-live activities and post go-live support
Supports knowledge sharing and knowledge transfer to IT colleagues and end users
Apply the Amcor Project Management Methodology with accountability for milestones while engaging and/or leading appropriate project team members (IT and Business)
Responsible for defining project requirements, project scope, timeline, resources, obtaining Business and IT agreement on these items prior to project start

Qualifications/Requirements
Bachelor’s degree, in computer science, management information systems or a related field or equivalent experience
3 - 5+ years of work experience in SAP systems
Experience in a global environment desirable
SAP MII (solution for shopfloor) and its integration with SAP ERP
General knowledge of SAP ERP, especially in the modules FICO, MM, PP and SD
Advanced English and Spanish communication level (spoken, written); other languages (Portuguese) will be considered an advantage
Agility, sound judgment, independent thinking, follow-through and initiative
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Focus on continuous improvement and business processes
Effective communications skills
Ability to effectively work cross-functionally and able to demonstrate facilitation skills in a global environment
Good organizational skills and the ability to work well both independently and as a member of a team
Amcor is a global leader in developing and producing responsible packaging solutions for food, beverage, pharmaceutical, medical, home and personal-care, and other products. Amcor works with leading companies around the world to protect their products and the people who rely on them, differentiate brands, and improve supply chains through a range of flexible and rigid packaging, specialty cartons, closures, and services. The company is focused on making packaging that is increasingly lighter weight, recyclable and reusable, and made using an increasing amount of recycled content. In fiscal year 2022, 44,000 Amcor people generated $15 billion in annual sales from operations that span 220 locations in 43 countries. NYSE: AMCR; ASX: AMC
At Amcor we believe in talent through diversity and promote equal opportunity in the workplace and recognise that discrimination and harassment of co-workers based on race, creed, disability, gender, marital or maternity status, religious or political beliefs, age or sexual orientation is unlawful.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Quem somos

A PS2 OPTIMA Solutions é uma empresa de Tecnologia voltada para Gestão de Desempenho de Aplicações, Serviços Gerenciados de banco de dados e cloud, e consultoria especializada em Quality Assurance e Inovação. Atuamos em todas as etapas do ciclo de vida da aplicação, atendendo aos principais desafios de TI.

Atuamos há mais de 10 anos em grandes players de diversos segmentos agregando valor ao negócio de nossos clientes.

Título da vaga: Engenheiro de Dados

Como Engenheiro de Dados você irá:

Nessa posição você será responsável por implementação e manutenção de pipelines para ingestão de dados, functions cloud, extração de dados, manutenção em processos de integração, ETLs e atendimento de incidentes relacionados

Requisitos:

· Experiência em desenvolvimento Python ou Java, ETL
· Experiência com repositórios de controle de versionamento
· Conhecimento em metodologia ágil
· Conhecimento em datalake, csv, parquet, delta
· Experiência com bancos de dados relacionais

Desejável:

Conhecimento técnico em azure datafactory, azure functions, aws lambda, SSIS, databricks
Conhecimento em trello, devops

Idiomas:

Espanhol e Inglês serão considerados diferenciais.

Educação:

Ensino Superior completo em área de Tecnologia de Informação.

A atuação será em modelo híbrido onde você terá a oportunidade de trabalhar em casa as terças e quintas e também interagir com o nosso time no escritório as segundas, quartas e sextas.

Onde estamos: Nossa empresa está localizada em Cotia/SP, no Shopping Open Mall The Square.

Benefícios:

• Assistência Médica
• Vale Refeição
• Vale Transporte
• Subsídio Estacionamento
• Seguro de Vida
• Vale presente no seu aniversário
• PLR.

Todas as nossas vagas são elegíveis para pessoas com deficiência.

Faixa Salarial:
A combinar

Venha fazer parte do nosso time e gerar impactos positivos em nossos clientes!

required_skills: ['Analyze Information', 'Controle operacional', 'DMS (Sistema de gerenciamento de documentos)', 'Habilidades analíticas', 'Linhas de produção', 'Paletes', 'Pensamento crítico', 'Rastreabilidade', 'Relatório', 'Sistemas de gerenciamento de armazéns (WMS)']
description:
Sobre a vaga
A General Mills está comprometida em ser uma força do bem por meio de uma estratégia global de inclusão para levar diversidade às nossas pessoas e cultura, possibilitando maiores níveis de envolvimento com nossos colaboradores para crescermos junto com nossos clientes e consumidores.

Para nós, criar um ambiente inclusivo e fomentar a diversidade impulsiona o crescimento da companhia, além de dar suporte para o crescimento de nossos colaboradores.

Analista de Proução Junior. Se identificou com a posição? Candidate-se agora mesmo!

Sobre a Posição

O (a) Analista (a) de Produção Junior, terá como missão o s uporte gerencial na condução de processos e controles operacionais. Atuando como guardião dos processos de melhoria contínua na área operacional, bem como a gestão da rotina dos resultados gerados pela cadeia operacional de supply chain: gestão dos lançamentos, perdas, inventário e tratativas necessárias para o atingimento dos objetivos e metas estabelecidas

Principais Responsabilidades

Lançar e analisar relatórios operacionais
Analisar estorno de perdas, lançamentos, consumos e encerramentos das ordens quando necessário
Realizar Heath Ckeck e plano de ação semanal com reporte no WMS para conformidade com as politicas da GMI
Executar, controlar e lançar o estorno de paletes acabados e retidos
Suportar os auxiliares operacionais na atualização do SAP e lançamentos de divergências de estoque BRPR/BRPP
Controlar, mapear e analisar informações de Waste
Atuar como suporte dos auxiliares operacionais que executam atividades administrativas dentro do seu escopo de trabalho
Analisar e executar as tratativas nas divergências sistêmicas, bem como garantir os acertos de lançamentos, destino dos materiais e processos de inventário
Gerir os relatórios de perdas e ganhos, scrap, investigar BOM x Rastreabilidade
Analisar e reportar as RNC´s, quando necessário
Participar ativamente dos temas de Waste, bem como suportar a liderança nas ações e tratativas
Participar e conduzir processos de melhoria contínua da área
Analisar e reportar informações sobre head count/capacidade, absenteísmo e produtividade de mão de obra
Suportar na gestão dos KPI´s operacionais
Participar e suportar as reuniões DMS e WMS na área
Realizar e conduzir estudos de standards de linhas produtivas
Suportar a análise crítica dos lançamentos de paradas de máquinas
Analisar e controlar o budget da área em parceria com a gerência da área
Participar ativamente da Estratégia de Cultura de Perda Zero
Ser multiplicador e atuar de acordo com os comportamentos do Líder Engajador GMI.

Requisitos

Ensino Superior Completo em Engenharia de Produção, Alimentos, Mecânica, Mecatrônica, Tecnologia, Gestão ou áreas correlatas
Forte domínio nas ferramentas da Qualidade e melhoria contínua
Experiência no segmento industrial. Ramo alimentício é diferencial
Conhecimentos em análise crítica de riscos
Conhecimento SAP
Domínio Excel Avançado
Fluencia em inglês será considerado diferencial
Disponibilidade para atuar presencialmente em Pouso Alegre

description:
Sobre a vaga
Build something new with a world-class team.

At Genesys, we allow our employees to make their mark by entrusting them to make decisions and do what they’ve been hired to do: their very best. Your potential is waiting; why are you?

Job Description

Genesys is looking for a highly driven Business Systems Analyst to join our Chief Data and Analytics Officer team as a member of our customer facing team. This is a unique position which requires deep business and technical expertise coupled with the ability to solve problems creatively and effectively. As a Business Systems Analyst, you will go deep into one or more areas of our business and partner with those stakeholders to assess business outcome requirements, analyze their data insights needs and challenges, identify process improvement and automation opportunities, propose business and system architectures, initiate proofs of concept efforts for specific outcomes and capabilities, develop a backlog of epics and stories, and work closely with the development teams to deliver analytical product(s).

The role of a Business Systems Analyst will have responsibility for providing business, functional, and technical expertise in identifying, evaluating, and implementing process, data, and functional solutions through data insights that support business outcomes that enable our partners to achieve their strategic objectives and grow the business.

What you'll get to do:

The primary responsibilities for this role include (but are not limited to):

Work in an agile environment, providing leadership to a team of technologists, constantly delivering and iterating on analytical solutions.
Going beyond relationship management, you’ll embed yourself into a customer facing business area, be a trusted partner, help them set analytical priorities and provide progress updates on our team commitments to those business stakeholders and our leadership
Use your business sense and process knowledge to evaluate things holistically and think through the objectives, impacts, best practices, tradeoffs, and what will be most impactful and scalable to determine the best analytical solution to support the business.
Use your excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively collaborate with a diverse group of people, to tease out and document business requirements and outcomes

Your experience should include:

5+ years of experience in, analytics, business intelligence, data architecture, including data modeling (logical & physical), data visualization, data warehousing, and analytical enablement
5+ years of business experience, with demonstrated project management, product management or managerial skills
5+ years of experience reviewing and writing technical & business requirements in relation to insights, effective data visualization, data management, metrics/KPIs or software development projects
5+ years of experience in marketing, finance, operational, or management reporting as a business systems analyst
Strong knowledge of project & program management techniques and tools as well as product owner experience (Agile/Scrum Master/Product Owner certification preferred, experience with Jira preferred).
Strong empathy for customers and the ability to think and design from the customers perspective with a strong ability to find the 80/20 solution when necessary
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Desirable Qualifications Skills:

Bachelor’s degree in the field of business, computer science or similar area or equivalent work experience
Salesforce or other CRM experience
PMP or equivalent

About Genesys:

Every year, Genesys orchestrates billions of remarkable customer experiences for organizations in more than 100 countries. Through the power of our cloud, digital and AI technologies, organizations can realize Experience as a Service™ our vision for empathetic customer experiences at scale. With Genesys, organizations have the power to deliver proactive, predictive, and hyper personalized experiences to deepen their customer connection across every marketing, sales, and service moment on any channel, while also improving employee productivity and engagement. By transforming back-office technology to a modern revenue velocity engine Genesys enables true intimacy at scale to foster customer trust and loyalty. Visit www.genesys.com.

Reasonable Accommodations:

If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you or someone you know may complete the Reasonable Accommodations Form for assistance. Please use the Candidate field in the dropdown menu to ensure a timely response.

This form is designed to assist job seekers who seek reasonable accommodation for the application process. Submissions entered for non-accommodation-related issues, such as following up on an application or submitting a resume, may not receive a response.

Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, domestic partner status, national origin, genetics, disability, military and veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Please note that recruiters will never ask for sensitive personal or financial information during the application phase.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Company Description

Continental is one of the biggest supplier for the Automotive industry, a global company recognized by its high technology Products, Services and Quality deliveries.

Working at Continental means you will actively contribute to a better future in terms of road safety, sustainability and high tech developments. Be prepared to challenge the current world, always looking for improvements and open for new ideas!

Job Description
Responsible for developing, reviewing and maintaining test specifications for product functionalities
Responsible for ensuring traceability according to given requirements and specifications
Responsible for analyzing and reviewing customer and internal requirements
Responsible for the automation of manual tests
Participates in test execution of manual and automation tests
Responsible for technical analysis of critical problems in his/ her area of expertise
Responsible for verifying test results and creating reports. May communicate test results/methods to customers (internal and external)
Responsible for defining and setting the test environment components according to the project needs
Participates in development of the test environment
Responsible for ensuring the testing equipment availability for the test team, including the test equipment for test automation

Qualifications
Bachelor Degree in Engineering Field, e.g. Electronic & Engineering
Able to speak and write in English
Knowledge in DOORS and JIRA
Test tools knowledge: instrumentation for measurement and control (e.g. osciloscope, power supply, CANoe)
Electronics knowledge (e.g. knowledge of the functionality of discreet components, reading schmatics)
Test automation concept and design
Test methods and techniques as defined in ISTQB
Understanding of test process (SW, EE, ME) and test levels

Additional Information

Diversity and team work are key for a highly productive environment. We do value these aspects in our internal culture.

Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.

required_skills: ['Contabilidade fiscal', 'Cumprimento das obrigações fiscais', 'Imposto sobre Produtos Industrializados (IPI)', 'Remessas', 'Tributos']
description:
Sobre a vaga
AVISO: A TMF Group em nenhum momento solicita qualquer tipo de pagamento como parte do nosso processo seletivo, e sempre contatamos nossos candidatos via contas e plataformas corporativas. Se você foi abordado e com solicitação de pagamento, trata-se de uma fraude. Por favor, verifique se a vaga a qual você está interessado, está publicada em nosso site.

SOBRE A TMF GROUP

A TMF Group ajuda seus clientes a operar internacionalmente e 'pertencer' a qualquer lugar do mundo. Nosso trabalho inclui apoiar empresas de todos os tamanhos com serviços como RH e Folha de Pagamento, Contabilidade, Secretariado Corporativo, Governança Global e Administração e Serviços Fiduciários para Finanças Estruturadas, Private Equity e Investimentos Imobiliários. Em 2022 a TMF Group adquiriu a Paraty Capital, uma plataforma brasileira de administração de fundos com foco em fundos de Private Equity, infraestrutura e Venture Capital.

SOBRE O SEU PERFIL
Escolaridade: Superior completo
Informática: Pacote Office +ERP (desejável)
Idioma: Inglês intermediário (desejável)
SOBRE A POSIÇÃO
Apurar tributos indiretos e retidos na fonte (ICMS, ICMS-ST, IPI, ISS, CSRF, INSS e IRRF);
Preparar e entregar, tempestivamente, as obrigações acessórias (EFD-ICMS/IPI, EFD-REINF, DIRF, DCTF, GIA, livros de apuração, GISS online, etc);
Interpretar e aplicar a legislação em vigor em consonância com as operações e atividades promovidas por Clientes, com apoio e supervisão de profissionais mais experientes;
Calcular tributos sobre remessas ao exterior (IRRF, CIDE, PIS, COFINS e ISS);
Analisar operações de importação e calcular os tributos incidentes;
Conciliar os saldos dos livros e obrigações acessórias com contas ativas e passivas de tributos indiretos;
Orientar tecnicamente profissionais menos experientes;
Apoiar a liderança nas rotinas e questões técnicas de tributos indiretos.
O QUE OFERECEMOS
Modelo Hibrido (até 3 dias no escritório)
Vale Transporte (desconto 2,5%)
Assistência Médica
Assistência Odontológica
Vale Refeição / Alimentação
Convênio Farmácia
Seguro de Vida
GymPass
Previdência Privada
Day-off de Aniversário
Presente de Nascimento
Presente de Casamento
Desconto Cinema
Quick Massage
Serviços de Manicure
Ginástica Laboral
Parcerias de Educação
Ajuda de Custo Home-office
Auxílio Creche
Plataforma de Idiomas Online
Programa de Orientação e Apoio Pessoal
Licença Maternidade 180 dias
Licença Paternidade 20 dias
O QUE TEMOS

Impacto Internacional

Nossa presença global em mais de 80 países permite que você influencie a maneira como diversos clientes globais fazem negócios, bem como retribuir as comunidades globais em que operamos.

Seja parte do One TMF

Na TMF Group, nosso pessoal é o que nos torna quem somos. Nossa empresa prospera com o espírito empreendedor de pessoas proativas que combinam entusiasmo com responsabilidade e prestação de contas.

Um mundo de oportunidades

Independentemente de onde você esteja em sua carreira, a TMF Group abre um mundo de oportunidades onde você fará parte de nossa equipe e receberá suporte em sua jornada profissional.

Sendo uma instituição com oportunidades iguais, TMF Group visa diversidade buscando contratar e desenvolver profissionais talentosos, independentemente de sua idade, raça, etnia, gênero, orientação sexual, deficiência, religião e educação. Acreditamos que as diferentes historias, origens, e experiências multiculturais de nossos colaboradores são um poderoso elemento para a criação de um ambiente inclusivo e diversificado onde todos se sintam à vontade em demonstrar sua personalidade única e autentica no trabalho. Trabalhamos fortemente para conseguir criar um ambiente de trabalho que reflita as comunidades que servimos e perspectivas únicas que nossa diversa equipe traz para a nossa companhia e clientes.
