company: {'name': 'Atlas Renewable Energy', 'size': '201-500 funcionários', 'sector': 'Geração de energia renovável'}
required_skills: ['Microsoft Excel', 'Administração de empresas', 'Estatística', 'Finanças', 'Física', 'Habilidades analíticas', 'Inglês', 'Mapeamento de processos', 'Ordens de compra']
description:
Sobre a vaga
If you are passionate about the world of renewable energies, you are motivated to contribute to a more sustainable world and you want to be part of a diverse team and a vibrant culture, don't miss this opportunity to take a new step in your professional life!


What do we do?

Atlas Renewable Energy was founded by an experienced team, pioneers in the development of renewable energies, with a recognized track record in the US, Latam and Europe. Since its founding in 2017, Atlas Renewable Energy has established itself in the Americas as one of the fastest growing large-scale clean energy generators in the region.
Our approach is focused on creating tailored solutions to provide clean energy to large consumers, guaranteeing the highest level of excellence during the development, construction and management of projects and serving as agents of change in the communities where we operate, promoting a lifestyle sustainability, diversity and inclusion and supporting their development. Our leadership in the industry is shown through the implementation of rigorous quality controls in the execution of our projects and total transparency, as well as by our innovative character

What are we looking for?
We are looking for a FP&A Analyst to support Asset Management team in our Brazilian Financial Planning and Analysis department.

The FP&A analyst will be responsible for improving the dynamic of Asset Management reports for Brazilian projects, consolidating information, gathering inputs from different departments and prepare operational and strategic analyses.

experiences 1-3 years


What Challenges you will face?
Support FP&A team with asset management and investment reports related to activities such as consolidation data reports, suppliers contracts and invoices, cash and accrual analysis.
Support our team by producing deadline-driven, quick-turnaround analysis, presenting it to the board and by maintaining and create user-friendly databases.
Participate in meetings with national/international teams including C-level executives, investors and lenders.
Relationship with internal areas, to develop and execute in-house consultant projects such as budget improvement, process mapping, and strategic and operational planning.
Prepare and lead improvements in the area along with the accounting team, focusing on automate the monthly closing reports through ERP systems.
Daily and dynamic communication with multiple teams in Brazil and across LATAM to solve problems regarding operational budget, purchase orders (PO), consolidate information, prepare reports and debt analysis.


What specific knowledge do you require?
Work with multiple tools and methods from ERP, Power BI, Excel, and agile software like Asana
Graduated in courses such as Statistics, Math, Physics, Engineering, Business Administration, Economics.
Fluent in English [Spanish is a positive differential].


What Atlas offer you?

Belong to a multicultural, inclusive and diverse environment. We have a presence in the USA, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Uruguay and Colombia , and now Spain.
Being part of a company that promotes flexibility: work by objectives, Hybrid/flexible work style (home-office or in the office) in coordination with your supervisors.
20 work days of vacation (which you can take in advance, without having completed the year) additional days of rest for the end of the year holidays.
other economic benefits, such as a performance bonus, food vouchers.
We promote sports with our “In Motion” benefit,
We promote Health and Life, with our health and life insurance with high-level coverage.

If you think you have these requirements, do you want to be part of a multinational company in the growing and innovative energy sector? Please send us your C.V. to: recruiting@atlasren.com with the subject FP&A Brasil

position: Analista Júnior de Prevenção de Perdas - Mercado Envios
company: {'name': 'Mercado Livre', 'size': '+ de 10.001 funcionários', 'sector': 'Tecnologia, Informação e Internet'}
required_skills: ['Análise financeira', 'Física', 'Gestão de equipes', 'Habilidades analíticas', 'Inteligência de negócios (BI)', 'Lenel', 'Liderança de equipe', 'Pesquisa qualitativa', 'Pesquisa secundária', 'Relacionamentos interpessoais']
description:
Sobre a vaga
No Mercado Livre, estamos democratizando o comércio, o dinheiro e os pagamentos na América Latina.
No Mercado Envios, administramos o estoque das pessoas que vendem e entregamos os produtos para as que compram, melhorando sua experiência em nossa plataforma. Em um mundo em constante evolução, nossa capacidade para entregar rapidamente os produtos que são comprados através do Mercado Livre tornou-se um requisito para competir. Faça parte da equipe que está liderando a logística na América Latina, oferecendo soluções customizadas de classe mundial e integrando carriers locais e regionais, através de um comércio que não reconhece fronteiras.
Temos um desafio para as pessoas que:
Vibram energia empreendedora: são movidas pela curiosidade, nunca desistem e estão focadas em superar seus próprios limites.
Dão o máximo, porque adoram trabalhar com compromisso e dedicação.
Encaram as mudanças como oportunidades e aprendem com seus erros.
A excelência e a execução são primordiais na sua forma de fazer as coisas.
Promovem o bom clima, a alegria e a diversão.
Sabem como construir com outras pessoas e desfrutam trabalhando em equipe.
Imagine você empreendendo projetos desafiadores, dinâmicos e inovadores, e sendo responsável por:
Controlar o fluxo do tráfego dos caminhões e participar do controle de entrada e saída da operação na troca de turno.
Realizar rondas e caminhadas de segurança e prevenção de perdas dentro das áreas da operação, três ou quatro vezes por turno solucionar os problemas em campo e relatar as anomalias encontradas
Garantir que a distribuição dos guardas na operação do Centro de Abastecimento e Distribuição atenda ao estabelecido no manual de procedimentos.
Elaborar a ficha de controle de processos para os guardas, gerar reuniões de acompanhamento das atividades e coletar informações sobre as novidades dos plantões.
Participar das investigações para a obtenção de informações sobre o evento ocorrido durante a operação do Centro de Abastecimento e Distribuição.
Requisitos:
Possuir formação superior completa em carreiras da área de segurança e afins, sendo desejável experiência em posições similares, especialmente como Contador Auditor, e rotinas administrativas.
Contar com conhecimentos de nível básico sobre o pacote Office e Power BI.
Ter experiência em aplicações internas, como Sistemas de Gerenciamento de Armazém e de Transporte, Tableau, Genetec, Lenel e na proteção física e eletrônica.
Ter disponibilidade para atuar no Centro de Distribuição em Perus - São Paulo, no horário das 12:00 às 21:48 horas, em escala 5x2.
Nós lhe propomos:
Ser parte de uma empresa com espírito empreendedor, na qual adoramos pensar grande e em longo prazo.
Ser protagonista de seu desenvolvimento em um ambiente de oportunidades, aprendizagem, crescimento, expansão e projetos desafiadores.
Compartilhar e aprender em equipe, com excelentes profissionais e especialistas.
Um excelente clima de trabalho, com todo o necessário para você viver uma grande experiência. :)
No Mercado Livre, trabalhamos para promover uma cultura inclusiva, que busca a equidade e valoriza as diferentes perspectivas. Isso se traduz em Gênero, Religião, Pessoas com Deficiência, LGBTQIA+, Etnia e diversidade de experiências. Trabalhamos todas as nossas vagas com base nessa premissa. Faça parte do nosso time!

required_skills: ['Comunicação', 'SQL', 'Azure Databricks', 'Data warehouse', 'ETL (Extração, transformação e carregamento)', 'Modelagem de dados', 'Modelagem dimensional', 'Pipeline de dados', 'PySpark', 'Snowflake']
description:
Sobre a vaga
A U.S.-based company reshaping the way organizations think and drive their business is looking for a Data Engineer. The engineer will be responsible for creating functional solutions and approaches to problems while ensuring proper implementation. The company provides financial and business advisory services that cover a broad range of consulting solutions. This is a nice opportunity for developers to make a name for themselves and drive innovative projects.

Job Responsibilities:

Provide end-to-end functional software landscape and solution design to support the company’s business processes
Evaluate requirements and translate them to business processes
Provide direction to the implementation teams and work as intermediaries across the local and onshore teams
Standardize and implement code branching strategy
Enable developers with automation of deployments and testing frameworks
Document, implement and audit security and access permissions for the data platform
Follow and implement CI/CD and data pipelines for cloud data platform
Participate in driving engineering best practices around software development processes

Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 5+ years of experience creating data pipelines in Python
A minimum of 2+ years of experience in creating data pipelines using PySpark in Databricks
At least 2+ years of experience in SQL
3+ years of experience designing, building and maintaining ETL/ELT data pipelines
A minimum of 3+ years of experience leveraging, designing and building dimensional modeling
Experience creating and supporting a complete ELT/ETL pipeline
Knowledge of data movement tools, data stores, and cloud-based environments
Demonstrable experience building and supporting a modern next generation data warehouse platform
Solid understanding of data modeling and architecture
Exposure to and support of downstream data usages for visualization and data science
Ability to explain complex technical challenges to technical and business audiences
Extensive knowledge of release/change management process
Working experience with Scrum and Agile methodologies with geographically distributed teams
Experience as DevOps skill is a plus
Knowledge of AWS IAM and security policy management and service configurations and compliance management
Experience with managing and scaling cloud data warehouse (Snowflake)
Experience with AWS ecosystem – S3, Amazon RDS, Amazon ML ecosystem
Experience in GitHub integration and CI/CD pipeline development
Experience using orchestration tools like Apache Airflow
Experience working with large datasets and big data technologies, preferably cloud-based, such as Snowflake, Databricks, or similar
Excellent English communication and interpersonal skills

required_skills: ['Análise de dados', 'Comunicação', 'Analítica de dados', 'Análise quantitativa', 'Cross-team Communication', 'Finanças quantitativas', 'Group Communication', 'Looker (Software)', 'Modelagem financeira', 'Processos operacionais']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Why join us

Brex empowers the next generation of businesses with an integrated corporate card and spend management software. We make it easy for our customers to manage every aspect of spending and empower their employees to make better financial decisions from anywhere they live or work. Brex proudly serves tens of thousands of growing businesses, from early-stage startups to enterprise leaders.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Operations Team at Brex

The Operations team is the bridge between our product and our customers. Our priority is to keep our customers happy and their businesses protected, while delivering vital information back to our internal teams. We are responsible for underwriting all of our customers, while simultaneously managing Brex’s risk exposures. We work cross-functionally with Risk, Compliance, Data, and Engineering to allow Brex to scale efficiently, keeping quality top of mind.

What You’ll Do

Throughout this 20-month program, analysts will rotate through our Operations teams, learning about risk management, operations processes, procedures, data reporting and analysis while also contributing to critical process improvements and developments.

You will be testing different approaches and will challenge the status quo to bring insight from each rotation to the next, streamlining processes and improving cross-team communication. During each rotation, you will have one core project focused on key data insights, process implementation, or process improvement. You will have the opportunity to share your findings with your program class and Brex Executives. The Operations Analyst Rotational Program is supported by Brex’s Co-Founders and Leadership Team.

Responsibilities

Maintain day-to-day operations for each rotation
Analyze business inefficiencies and propose solutions to our leadership team
Work cross-functionally within operations and departments outside of operations improve existing processes, and create multi-team procedures

Requirements

Must have graduated with Bachelor's degree by June 2023
Professional proficiency in spoken and written English
Demonstrated knowledge, understanding, and insight of business concepts and processes that are needed for making decisions
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment while successfully adapting to change
A keen interest in business operations
Experience in financial modeling, data analysis, or a similar area where you have applied your knowledge of techniques and tools to promote effective analysis
Proven ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams as well as independently

Bonus points

Strong understanding of Salesforce Service Cloud and Salesforce Reporting
Experience in SQL and Looker reporting
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, with the ability to convey complex and relevant information to a wide range of audiences

Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

required_skills: ['Contabilidade estatuária', 'Contas a pagar', 'Contas a receber', 'FI-AA', 'Gestão de requisitos', 'Ledger', 'Monitoramento proativo', 'Razão geral', 'Requisitos de negócio', 'SAP FI']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Location: SÃO PAULO

São Paulo, SP

Ferrero is a family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands such as Nutella®, Tic Tac®, Ferrero Rocher®, Raffaello®, Kinder Bueno® and Kinder Surprise®. As the love for our brands continues to grow, so too does our global reach. Represented in 55 countries, with products sold in more than 170, the Ferrero Group is loved by generations around the world. The secret to our global success? Nearly 35,000 dedicated employees who celebrate care and quality to craft a business, careers and brands we are proud of. Join us, and you could be one of them.

Diversity Statement:

Ferrero is committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture in which all employees feel welcomed and appreciated and have the same opportunities. We believe all of our people are equally talented in their own way. In nurturing the curiosity and natural abilities of our employees, we provide them, generation after generation, the means to succeed personally and professionally, enabling them to craft their journey at Ferrero. The diversity of our talents is what makes our work environment multicultural, innovative and highly rewarding.

About the Role:

We are currently looking for an IT SAP South America Finance Specialist who will be part of IT Finance Center of Expertise Team located in Brazil and he/she will report to the IT Finance COE.

Main Responsibilities:

Develop, maintain and support SAP FI Accounting (General Ledger, Account Payable, Account Receivable, Asset Accounting) application in SAP FI-GL/FI-AP/FI-AR/FI-AA technologies/module that meet Business Requirements managing the application lifecycle from implementation up to retirement.
Guarantee IT application are aligned with Ferrero’s business strategy and ensure quality of delivery.
Work on the 3rd level ticket support related to SAP Accounting ensuring timely communication and resolution of support tickets and related project work
Through proactive monitoring or during testing phase, identify and fix potential IT defect and evaluate IT Enhancement/Improvement requests in SAP FI applications
Provide technical expertise and guidance to external resources, assign capabilities and collaborate with other IT teams in cross initiatives/projects/run activities.
Dedicate support during month/year-end closure.

Who we are looking for:

A professional graduate in IT, Engineering or Business Management
A professional with strong experience in SAP FI module in particularly in SAP FI-GL/FI-AP/FI-AR/FI-AA.
A professional with strong experience in Brazilian Localization in particularly in Mastersaf (DFE and DW), CTE, E-Invoicing, Country, State and City taxes payments.
Experience and Knowledge in Argentina, Colombia and Ecuador localization is a plus.
Localization means the government requirements for fiscal books, ECD, ECF, Bloco K, REINF, and other local needs in regarding to tax payments in the income and outcome.
Experienced in SAP TR and FSCM module is appreciated
Knowledge in SAP S4hana will be considered a plus as well as knowledge in interface connection system
Strong analytical skills and problem solving oriented, proactive and team player
Project Management and Team Management skills are a plus.
Experienced in international companies in FMCG or retail with central HQ / Service company
Proficiency in English. Other languages will be considered as a plus (Spanish, Italian etc.)
A person available for international mobility

How to be successful in the role and at Ferrero:

Consumers, quality and care are at the heart of everything we do. So, to be successful at Ferrero, you’ll need to be just as consumer and product centric as we are - dedicated to crafting brilliant results for consumers around the world.

description:
Sobre a vaga
SOBRE A TMF GROUP

A TMF Group ajuda seus clientes a operar internacionalmente e 'pertencer' a qualquer lugar do mundo. Nosso trabalho inclui apoiar empresas de todos os tamanhos com serviços como RH e Folha de Pagamento, Contabilidade, Secretariado Corporativo, Governança Global e Administração e Serviços Fiduciários para Finanças Estruturadas, Private Equity e Investimentos Imobiliários. Em 2022 a TMF Group adquiriu a Paraty Capital, uma plataforma brasileira de administração de fundos com foco em fundos de Private Equity, infraestrutura e Venture Capital.

SOBRE O SEU PERFIL
Escolaridade: Ensino Superior em andamento;
Informática: Pacote Office +ERP (desejável);
Idioma: Inglês intermediário (desejável);
Conhecimentos sólidos em lançamento de Notas Fiscais de entrada, Retenção de Impostos, Cadastro/Movimento de Bens do Ativo Imobilizado, Cálculo e Processamento de Depreciação, Ciap (Controle de Crédito de ICMS s/Ativo Imobilizado), domínio de atividades que contemplem as atividades de Contas a Pagar e a Receber, conhecimentos básicos em apurações de impostos incidentes sobre o faturamento tais como: Pis, Cofins, ICMS, IPI e ISS, Demonstrativos Financeiros e Contábeis.
SOBRE A POSIÇÃO
Efetuar correções operacionais em problemas detectados no input dos documentos fiscais no ERP;
Contabilizar folha de pagamento;
Efetuar análises de contas patrimoniais e regularizar pendências contábeis;
Manter controle das operações de empréstimos, leasing, fornecedores estrangeiros, partes relacionadas e variação cambial;
Efetuar contabilização das atualizações monetárias de créditos fiscais;
Efetuar revisão nos lançamentos efetuados em contas de resultado;
Efetuar o fechamento contábil mensal, assegurando que todas as contas do balancete foram analisadas;
Auxiliar nas respostas aos clientes sobre dúvidas em relação aos registros contábeis efetuadas.
O QUE OFERECEMOS
Modelo Hibrido (até 3 dias no escritório)
Vale Transporte (desconto 2,5%)
Assistência Médica
Assistência Odontológica
Vale Refeição / Alimentação
Convênio Farmácia
Seguro de Vida
GymPass
Previdência Privada
Day-off de Aniversário
Presente de Nascimento
Presente de Casamento
Desconto Cinema
Quick Massage
Serviços de Manicure
Ginástica Laboral
Parcerias de Educação
Ajuda de Custo Home-office
Auxílio Creche
Plataforma de Idiomas Online
Programa de Orientação e Apoio Pessoal
Licença Maternidade 180 dias
Licença Paternidade 20 dias
O QUE TEMOS

Impacto Internacional

Nossa presença global em mais de 80 países permite que você influencie a maneira como diversos clientes globais fazem negócios, bem como retribuir as comunidades globais em que operamos.

Seja parte do One TMF

Na TMF Group, nosso pessoal é o que nos torna quem somos. Nossa empresa prospera com o espírito empreendedor de pessoas proativas que combinam entusiasmo com responsabilidade e prestação de contas.

Um mundo de oportunidades

Independentemente de onde você esteja em sua carreira, a TMF Group abre um mundo de oportunidades onde você fará parte de nossa equipe e receberá suporte em sua jornada profissional.

Sendo uma instituição com oportunidades iguais, TMF Group visa diversidade buscando contratar e desenvolver profissionais talentosos, independentemente de sua idade, raça, etnia, gênero, orientação sexual, deficiência, religião e educação. Acreditamos que as diferentes historias, origens, e experiências multiculturais de nossos colaboradores são um poderoso elemento para a criação de um ambiente inclusivo e diversificado onde todos se sintam à vontade em demonstrar sua personalidade única e autentica no trabalho. Trabalhamos fortemente para conseguir criar um ambiente de trabalho que reflita as comunidades que servimos e perspectivas únicas que nossa diversa equipe traz para a nossa companhia e clientes.

required_skills: ['ABAP', 'Documentação', 'Habilidades analíticas', 'Parcerias', 'Processos de montagem', 'Produtos SAP', 'Relatório', 'SAP List Viewer (ALV)', 'Serviços web']
description:
Sobre a vaga
A PSM Company é especializada na identificação de Talentos para as áreas de TI / Telecom como também para as áreas operacionais e administrativas. Nossa história de sucesso, está baseada em nosso modelo de negócios que proporcionam assertividade e qualidade no processo seletivo, baixo Turn Over e isenção de riscos e passivos trabalhistas.

O que Buscamos?

Analista SAP ABAP SÊNIOR

O que precisa conhecer?
Vivência em atendimento ao cliente (AMS) e programação orientada a objeto
Linguagem ABAP
Module Pool
ALV
Smartform
Uso de BAPIs, Badi's, Exit's, Enhancement, RFC e Webservices

Atividades
Programar, desenvolver e implantar sustentação, melhorias e desenvolvimentos de projetos SAP/ABAP
Fazer análises e realizar correções sistêmicas, atendendo às necessidades dos usuários/áreas de negócio da empresa, gerando agilidade, controle e atuar sobre os incidentes das rotinas diárias
Desenvolver trabalhos de montagem, depuração e testes das soluções já desenvolvida para medir eficiência e identificar oportunidades de potencialização e estabilidade da operação
Treinar e orientar os usuários, visando a melhoria no processo, bem como gerar documentos que registrem o processo, conforme governança da área de TI
Buscar soluções complementares e manter-se atualizado das mudanças/evolução de mercado
Fornecer informações e relatórios a sua gestão (pontualmente ou periódico), visando contribuir no gerenciamento e apresentação dos resultados esperados pela empresa


Contratação – CLT
Forma de trabalho – 100% presencial

Aqui na PSM respeitamos e zelamos muito para um ambiente inclusivo e diverso, sendo assim, você é bem-vinda independentemente de suas características ou condições quanto à etnia, gênero, orientação sexual, cultural, social e acessibilidade.
Participe de nossos processos seletivos, estamos te aguardando!! 🤝

O que oferecemos?
· Vale Refeição;
· Assistência Médica e Assistência Odontológica;
· Auxílio creche;
· Convênio com Farmácia;
· Cartão GoodCard;
· Parcerias com Universidades e Escolas de Idiomas;
· Parceria de descontos com Seguro Auto e Residência;
· Seguro de Vida.


“O seu interesse em participar deste processo seletivo, automaticamente consente, autoriza e concorda que a PSM COMPANY, no papel de CONTROLADORA, tome decisões referentes ao tratamento de seus dados pessoais para esta finalidade específica, em conformidade com a Lei nº 13.709 – Lei Geral de Proteção de Dados Pessoais (LGPD).”

required_skills: ['Capacidade de organização', 'Comunicação', 'Apresentações', 'Banco de investimento', 'Ciência de dados', 'Comunicação escrita', 'Comércio eletrônico', 'Marketing digital', 'Serviços de publicidade online', 'Teste A/B']
description:
Sobre a vaga
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to know our team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:

Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently

It’s great if you have:

Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

company: {'name': 'Labcorp', 'size': '+ de 10.001 funcionários', 'sector': 'Hospitais e atendimento à saúde'}
required_skills: ['Boas práticas clínicas', 'Computer Competency', 'Consentimento informado', 'Diretrizes regulamentares', 'Exigências regulatórias', 'ICH', 'Monitoramento clínico', 'Planos de projeto', 'Resolução de problemas', 'Viagens aéreas']
description:
Sobre a vaga
As a leading global contract research organization (CRO) with a passion for scientific rigor and decades of clinical development experience, Fortrea provides pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device customers a wide range of clinical development, patient access and technology solutions across more than 20 therapeutic areas. With over 19,000 staff conducting operations in more than 90 countries, Fortrea is transforming drug and device development for partners and patients across the globe.

Did you know?

Labcorp's Clinical Development and Commercialization Services business is now Fortrea in connection with its planned spin-off from Labcorp, which is expected in mid-2023. Fortrea’s spin-off from Labcorp is subject to satisfaction of certain customary conditions. This spin-off will position both organizations for accelerated growth and allow each to focus resources on distinct strategic priorities, customer and employee needs and value creation opportunities. As a provider of phase I-IV clinical trial management, regulatory guidance, patient access solutions and market access consulting, Fortrea will partner with both emerging and large pharmaceutical, biotechnology, device and diagnostic companies to drive healthcare innovation and improve the lives of patients worldwide.

Fortrea is looking for problem-solvers and creative thinkers who are passionate about breaking down barriers faced by sponsors of clinical trials, and who are committed to helping transform the development process to get promising life-changing ideas and therapies to patients faster. Join us as we cultivate a workspace where all employees have the opportunity to grow and make impacts on a global scale. For more information and questions related to Fortrea, please visit www.fortrea.com.

Essencial Job Duties
Responsible for all aspects of study site monitoring including routine monitoring and close-out of clinical sites, maintenance of study files, conduct of pre-study and initiation visits; liaise with vendors; and other duties, as assigned
Responsible for all aspects of site management as prescribed in the project plans
General On-Site Monitoring Responsibilities
Ensure the study staff who will conduct the protocol have received the proper materials and instructions to safely enter patients into the study
Ensure the protection of study patients by verifying that informed consent procedures and protocol requirements are adhered to according to the applicable regulatory requirements
Ensure the integrity of the data submitted on Case Report Forms (CRFs) or other data collection tools by careful source document review
Monitor data for missing or implausible data
Ensure the resources of the Sponsor and Labcorp are spent wisely by performing the required monitoring tasks in an efficient manner, according to SOPs and established guidelines, including managing travel expenses in an economical fashion according to Labcorp travel policy
Ensure audit readiness at the site level
Travel, including air travel, may be required and is an essential function of the job.
Prepare accurate and timely trip reports Responsible for all aspects of registry management as prescribed in the project plans
Undertake feasibility work when requested
Participate in and follow up on Quality Control Visits (QC) when requested
Recruitment of potential investigators, preparation of EC submissions, notifications to regulatory authorities, translation of study-related documentation, organization of meetings and other tasks as instructed by supervisor
Might be requested to work in a client facing environment
Track and follow up on Serious Adverse Event (SAE) reporting, process production of reports, narratives and follow up of SAE
Independently perform CRF review; query generation and resolution against established data review guidelines on Labcorp or client data management systems as assigned by management
Assist with training, of new employees, e.g. co-monitoring
Coordinate designated clinical projects as a Local Project Coordinator
Main Requirements
University or college degree, or certification in a related allied health profession from an appropriately accredited institution (e.g., nursing licensure).
Thorough knowledge of ICH Guidelines and understanding of local regulatory requirements
Previous experience with on-site Clinical Monitoring experience
Ability to monitor study sites independently according to protocol monitoring guidelines, SOP, and local regulatory Guidelines
Have a full understanding of the Serious Adverse Event (SAE) reporting, process production of reports, narratives and follow up of SAEs
Good planning, organization, and problem- solving abilities
Ability to work with minimal supervision
Good communication and interpersonal skills
Good analytical and negotiation skills
Computer competency
Fluent in local office language and in English, both written and verbal
Works efficiently and effectively in a matrix environment
Labcorp Is Proud To Be An Equal Opportunity Employer

As an EOE/AA employer, Labcorp strives for diversity and inclusion in the workforce and does not tolerate harassment or discrimination of any kind. We make employment decisions based on the needs of our business and the qualifications of the individual and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy or other medical conditions/needs), family or parental status, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, personal appearance, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic. We encourage all to apply.

For more information about how we collect and store your personal data, please see our Privacy Statement.

position: ANALISTA DE QUALIDADE ASSEGURADA II - ITAPIRA / SP
company: {'name': 'Cargill', 'size': '+ de 10.001 funcionários', 'sector': 'Fabricação de alimentos e bebidas'}
required_skills: ['Análise de riscos', 'Controle de qualidade', 'Fechamento de negociações imobiliárias', 'Linhas de produção', 'Procedimentos de qualidade', 'Segurança alimentar', 'Segurança de alimentos', 'Teste de regressão', 'Testes funcionais', 'Testes manuais']
description:
Sobre a vaga
PROPÓSITO E IMPACTO DO TRABALHO

O(A) ANALISTA DE QUALIDADE ASSEGURADA II, apoiará a liderança no estabelecimento, manutenção e auditoria de procedimentos, a fim de garantir o cumprimento de todos os sistemas federais, estaduais, regulatórios e de qualidade da empresa. Nesta função, você apoiará uma instalação moderadamente complexa, revisando certificações de terceiros e preparando respostas a perguntas, relatórios e reclamações de clientes ou inspeção decorrentes de inspeções de qualidade e segurança de alimentos ou produtos.

PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES

Promover a conscientização sobre a segurança de alimentos ou produtos em toda a fábrica para desenvolver as competências dos profissionais da planta e auxiliar outros em temas relacionados à segurança alimentar ou do produto, análise de riscos e pontos críticos de controle.
Auxiliar outros sobre temas relacionados à segurança de alimentos ou produtos, treinando, treinando e orientando novos membros da equipe em procedimentos de segurança de alimentos ou produtos.
Definir e atualizar os procedimentos de qualidade específicos, instruções e ferramentas que estão diretamente relacionados à segurança dos alimentos e produtos.
Realizar inspeções diárias da planta para cada um dos pontos críticos de controle e zonas de monitoramento para garantir que todos aderirem aos programas escritos de segurança alimentar ou de produtos.
Auxiliar na conclusão de auditorias internas e externas, de segurança e de qualidade, incluindo o fechamento de lacunas na produção e manutenção em um local com complexidade moderada e identificar e abordar proativamente áreas de risco básico.
Auxiliar no treinamento e engajamento da equipe.
Lidar com questões básicas e problemas sob supervisão direta, ao mesmo tempo em que escala questões mais complexas para a equipe apropriada.

QUALIFICAÇÕES

Superior em área relacionada
Experiência no plano APPCC / HACCP
Certificado de auditor interno
Excel intermediário / avançado
Inglês avançado para conversação
Desejável espanhol
Desejável conhecimento SAP

Na Cargill, todas as pessoas são importantes. A Cargill está comprometida em criar e manter um ambiente de trabalho inclusivo e diversificado, onde todos e todas são tratados com dignidade e respeito. Alinhada com nossos Princípios e Valores, a Cargill proíbe qualquer tipo de discriminação e  assédio contra qualquer pessoa ou candidato (a) no que diz respeito a: raça, etnia, cor, religião, nacionalidade, ascendência, sexo, gênero, identidade de gênero, expressão de gênero, orientação sexual, idade, deficiência, gravidez, informações genéticas, estado civil, status familiar, país de origem, afiliação a sindicato ou qualquer outro status protegido por lei. A Cargill também cumpre todas as leis e regulamentos nacionais e locais aplicáveis, relativos à não discriminação e empregabilidade.

A Cargill encoraja a vacinação contra a Covid-19 mas não obriga neste momento. Durante o processo admissional, você será questionado sobre seu status de vacinação, e se não for vacinado ou preferir não informar, é esperado que você siga protocolos específicos para empregado(as) não vacinados (exemplo: uso obrigatório de máscara, distanciamento social, restrição de acesso às instalações, etc).

position: Administrador(a) de banco de dados - DBMS
company: {'name': 'IBM', 'size': '+ de 10.001 funcionários', 'sector': 'Serviços e consultoria de TI'}
location: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brasil
required_skills: ['Banco de dados', 'Corte em cubos', 'Estratégia de nuvem', 'IBM Cloud', 'Nuvem híbrida', 'SGBD']
description:
Sobre a vaga
618551BR

Introdução

Na IBM, o trabalho é mais que uma tarefa. É um chamado para construir. Para projetar. Para codificar. Para consultar. Para pensar junto com os clientes e vender. Para construir mercados. Para inventar. Para colaborar. Não apenas para fazer algo melhor, mas para tentar coisas que você nunca imaginou serem possíveis. Para liderar nesta nova era da tecnologia e resolver alguns dos problemas mais desafiadores do mundo.

Seu papel e responsabilidades

Nesta função, você trabalhará em nosso IBM Client Innovation Center (CIC), onde oferecemos profundo conhecimento técnico e do setor para uma ampla gama de clientes do setor público e privado em todo o mundo. Esses centros oferecem aos nossos clientes habilidades e conhecimento técnico para impulsionar a inovação e a adoção de novas tecnologias.

As Principais Funções Incluem

Especialistas de TI nesta função terão experiência em uma ou mais áreas de produtos de software baseados em gerenciamento de dados relacionais e não relacionais.
Os exemplos incluem software de gerenciamento de dados mainstream, como os da IBM e da Oracle.
Exemplos típicos de entregas são a criação de soluções de prova de conceito com tecnologia de gerenciamento de dados e a arquitetura de soluções de gerenciamento de dados para atender aos requisitos do cliente.
Especialistas em TI que aplicam principalmente suas habilidades técnicas em um ambiente de implementação e serviços faturáveis de clientes internos ou externos.
O(a) funcionário(a) orienta os objetivos funcionais ou tecnologias.

Profissional Requerido e Conhecimento Técnico

Administrar banco de dados Oracle 12c, 19.
Aadministrar bancos single instance, bem como ASM instances e RAC databases (GRID).
Localizar falhas/ineficiências e implementar soluções diversas, atuando na análise, controle e modificação de métodos e processos.
Gerenciar usuários com segurança.
Efetuar e recuperar backups e restore e atender demandas de indisponibilidade.
Monitorar e ajustar a performance do banco de dados de forma proativa e reativa.
Realizar troubleshooting de banco e cumprir SLAs sempre seguindo políticas e normas.
Criar e atualizar procedimentos, desenvolver projetos ligados a banco de dados e outras atividades correlatas.
Inglês avançado/fluente.

***Todas as vagas são elegíveis para pessoas com deficiência ou reabilitadas.***

Profissional Preferencial e Conhecimento Técnico

N/A

Sobre a unidade de negócios

A IBM Consulting é a empresa de consultoria e serviços profissionais globais da IBM, com recursos de transformação de negócios e tecnologia líderes de mercado em. Com profundo conhecimento em muitas indústrias, oferecemos estratégia, experiência, tecnologia e serviços operacionais a muitas das empresas mais inovadoras e valiosas do mundo. Nosso time está focado em acelerar os negócios de nossos clientes através da colaboração. Acreditamos no poder da tecnologia usada de maneira responsável para ajudar pessoas, parceiros e o mundo.

Sua vida na IBM

Em um mundo onde a tecnologia nunca fica parada, entendemos que a dedicação ao sucesso dos nossos clientes, a inovação que faz a diferença, a confiança e a responsabilidade pessoal em todos os nossos relacionamentos estão presentes em tudo o que fazemos como IBMistas, na medida em que nos esforçamos para ser o catalisador que torna o serviço do mundo melhor.

Ser um IBMista significa que você será capaz de aprender e desenvolver a si mesmo e a sua carreira, você será incentivado a ser corajoso e a experimentar todos os dias, tendo confiança e suporte contínuos em um ambiente onde todos possam prosperar, seja qual for a sua experiência pessoal ou profissional.

Nossos IBMistas têm uma mentalidade focada na busca do conhecimento, mantendo-se sempre curiosos, abertos a feedbacks e a novas informações e habilidades de aprendizado para transformar constantemente a si mesmos e a nossa empresa. Eles são confiáveis para fornecer feedback contínuo para ajudar outros IBMistas a crescer, além de colaborar com os colegas tendo sempre em mente uma abordagem focada na equipe para englobar diferentes perspectivas para gerar resultados excepcionais para os nossos clientes. A coragem que os nossos IBMistas têm para tomar decisões críticas diariamente é essencial para que a IBM se torne o catalisador para o progresso, sempre abraçando os desafios com os recursos que têm em mãos, com uma postura proativa e primando sempre por uma abordagem focada no resultado dentro de tudo o que eles fazem.

Você está pronto para ser um IBMista?

Sobre a IBM

A maior invenção da IBM é o IBMista. Acreditamos que por meio da inteligência, do propósito e da ciência, podemos melhorar os negócios, a sociedade e a condição humana, potencializando a estratégia de Nuvem Híbrida Aberta e de Inteligência Artificial para nossos clientes e parceiros de todo o mundo.Estamos sempre nos reinventando, desde 1911, e não somos apenas uma das maiores organizações do mundo, somos também uma das maiores empresas de tecnologia e consultoria que está contratando novos talentos. Muitas empresas da Fortune 50 dependem da IBM Cloud para gerenciar seus negócios.Na IBM, temos orgulho de sermos uma das primeiras companhias a adotar inteligência artificial, computação quântica e blockchain. Esse é o momento certo para você se juntar a nós em nossa jornada para ser uma empresa de tecnologia inovadora e responsável, que deseja promover boas ações em todo o mundo.

Declaração de localização

Para obter informações adicionais sobre os requisitos de localização, entre em contato com o recrutador responsável por acompanhar sua candidatura.

Sendo você na IBM

A IBM está comprometida em criar um ambiente diversificado e tem orgulho de ser uma empregadora que oferece oportunidades iguais. Todos os candidatos qualificados serão considerados para o cargo, independentemente de raça, cor, religião, sexo, identidade ou expressão de gênero, orientação sexual, origem nacional, genética, gravidez, deficiência, idade, status de veterano ou outras características. A IBM também está comprometida em cumprir com todas as práticas trabalhistas justasrelacionadas a status de cidadania e imigração.

description:
Sobre a vaga
What you'll do

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and deploying cutting-edge machine learning models and systems. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business needs, gather requirements, and translate them into scalable machine learning solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, deep learning, and software engineering, along with a passion for solving complex problems and driving innovation.

Responsibilities
Design and develop scalable machine learning models and algorithms.
Train and evaluate models using large datasets to achieve high performance.
Preprocess and engineer features from raw data to enhance model performance.
Deploy machine learning models into production environments and integrate them into existing systems.Stay updated with the latest advancements in machine learning and conduct research to explore new techniques.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide technical guidance and mentorship.
Optimize model performance and address performance bottlenecks in machine learning pipelines.

Requirements
Master's or Ph.D. degree in computer science, machine learning, or a related field.
5+ years of proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, with a focus on developing and deploying machine learning models.
Strong proficiency in machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Expertise in deep learning architectures and techniques.
Proficient in programming languages such as Python, C++ or C.
Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and data visualization.
Strong understanding of software engineering principles and best practices.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a passion for tackling complex challenges.

Bonus Points
Fluent English proficiency.
Knowledge of cloud platforms and distributed computing framework

Compensation
Competitive salary and stock options
R$800/mo to use in a wide range of places that accept the Visa flag
GymPass so you don't sit/work all day
100% funded English / Spanish course
30 days of paid annual leave
Education and courses stipend
Every 4 years, earn a trip anywhere in the world
Day off in the week of your birthday
From R$2400/year remote work allowance
Mental health support: we cover 40% of the cost of your therapy
Health plan with national coverage and without coparticipation.
Dental Insurance: we help you with dental treatment for a better quality of life.
Sports Incentive: R$300/mo extra if you practice activities

required_skills: ['Análise de dados', 'Analítica de dados', 'Ciência de dados', 'Dashboards', 'Habilidades analíticas', 'Insights de negócios', 'Modelagem de dados', 'Qualidade dos dados', 'Streamlining Operational Processes', 'Visualização de dados']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Cognizant Technology Solutions is a North American IT multinational company based in New Jersey which has been in Brazil since 2009 with offices in São Paulo, Curitiba. Currently we have a team with more than a thousand associates, but we continue to grow exponentially and look for new talents who are interested in a career opportunity in one of the largest IT companies in the world.

We operate on several fronts: Digital Business, Digital Operations, Digital Systems and Technology (infrastructure, SAP, Salesforce, Mulesoft, QE&A, amongst others).

Our company believes in the power of diversity and inclusion, and it was this belief that has led us to win several awards, such as GPTW and Top Employer in recent years. In our hiring, we only take into account the candidate's talent and willingness to be part of the digital transformation of our clients, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity or religion. For us, the empowerment of our employees is very important, as we believe that our team is able to contribute to the constant evolution that we experience on a daily basis.

Data Analyst

Mapping Data Analyst is a subject-matter expert in data mining & analysis, and dashboard or report creation dedicated to improving operational efficiency, accuracy and consistency. The Mapping Data Analyst is expected to draw insights and find improvement opportunities, gather insights and make proposals, help accelerate throughput of models and algorithms, and act as a team’s data POC.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Understand analytical needs, document and prioritize requirements, and develop plans for process or tools improvement initiatives.

Build and maintain analytical SQL queries, scripts, and dashboards to track task progress or operational productivity.

Use statistical methods to analyze data and generate insightful project reports.

Identify and recommend new ways to improve quality and productivity by streamlining operational processes.

Collaborate and coordinate with other Advanced Operators to test hypotheses of possible process improvements.

Use SQL, Oracle, Python or other programing languages to prepare and present data in a way that is visually appealing and simple for clients to navigate and comprehend.

Assist in evolving data pipelines to improve throughput and provide near real-time data insights.

Quantify, track and manage solution implementation with before and after metrics.

Identify and develop data quality initiatives and opportunities for automation.

Ensure scripts and data management practices comply with internal best practices.

What are we offering?

Support in the development of your career, portal with several online courses in addition to the best market benefits such as: Pension Plan, Medical and Dental Plan, Meal voucher, Transportation voucher and Variable pay, remote, onsite and hybrid work.

We are a company that values, take cares of and cares about the health and well-being of its employees. In addition to the conventional benefits, we provide the Employee Assistance Program with confidential assistance is available to help you and your family to find solutions to personal and professional challenges.

Cognizant values diversity in our talent pool, so we encourage professionals with disabilities, LGBTQIA+, people in refugee situations, women, blacks, and professionals 50+ to apply for all of our advertised openings.

Employee Status : Full Time Employee

Shift : Day Job

Travel : No

Job Posting : May 19 2023

About Cognizant

Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant. 000541421926

description:
Sobre a vaga
Overview

Collection Analyst

As Collection Analyst, you will proactively work and support the invoice to cash process meaning that this position acts as the point of contact for all matters which relate to customer debt and billing.

The role facilitates the accounts receivable activity to generate cash flow through cash collection in line with Credit Management best practice. Working closely with customers at a regional level the role ensures customer debt for the region is kept at or below corporate target levels. It also contributes to the overall satisfaction of the customers with the billing deliverables.

The world is changing. Are you ready to define with future of travel with us?

What You Will Do
To execute all debt collection activity for an assigned portfolio of customers in a dedicated region. To act as the single point of contact to the customer for the resolution of any issues or complaints around invoice validation or content and for the understanding of the invoices billing
To pro-actively contact customers regarding due payments and be responsible for prompt & accurate allocation of all customer payments received against outstanding invoices. To reconcile & agree disputes over SITA and customer invoice data. To carry out any required reconciliations of historical debts.
To work collaboratively with other SITA teams to resolve issues affecting cash collection / revenue recognition or raise issues which may impact on customer satisfaction. In particular to ensure that any problems which impact billing (e.g. contract, service delivery, invoicing, or tax issues) are addressed promptly with the necessary parties to support resolution.
To build relationships with customers to enable agreement of customer re-payment plans. To monitor and track progress on action plans. To manage process to suspend customer services in event of continued non-payment, in line with SITA's agreed disconnection procedure and in accordance with SITA Credit Control Escalation Policy.
To address customer satisfaction issues in the billing and payment areas. To undertake, when necessary, any training with customers on SITA's invoices, payment best practices, and any other billing content and tools. Responsible to develop action plans after customers' surveys (e.g. CFF feedback on billing) or complaints (including escalations to Corporate level, e.g. Orange or Red Alerts). To record and anticipate the business requirements of the customers and work on proposing solutions.
To update any administrative data relating to customers (mailing address, payment method parameters, etc) in the Customer referential (e.g. CMS). Additionally, to update the status of the customer's account to reflect the current escalation process.
To keep data up-to-date for the production of any debt, billing or customer satisfaction reports. To participate, when required, to any regional cash or billing calls or meetings.
To act as a billing and payment process know-how point of contact for the Regions and Business Units. To this effect, to keep her/his knowledge of SITA's products and services, billing and payment processes up to date, and to attend all training that is necessary to maintain her/his know-how.

Qualifications

Who you are
Prior 2+ years in billing debt collection or customer service.
International Debt collection or Customer Billing experience is an advantage.
Fluent in English.
Intermediate Spanish and Portuguese.
Very good understanding of SITA billing system and processes.
Advanced user of MS Excel to manipulate & consolidate debtor or billing data.
Knowledge of Business Objects reporting.
Good understanding of products services and tariffs.
Ability to work within a high pressure environment with stretching targets.
Proven customer service skills.
Strong relationship management skills and able to work across culturally diverse teams.
Bachelor’s degree in business or economics is required.
Working towards a related professional certification.

What we offer

SITA’s workplace is all about diversity: many different countries and cultures are represented in our workforce, and colleagues who’ve been working here for decades collaborate with those just out of college and early in their careers. SITA is a place of change and constant improvement, where we're always pushing ourselves to find better ways of doing things: smarter, quicker, easier, for us and our customers and for their customers too.

And we offer all the good stuff you’d expect like holidays, bonus, flexible benefits, medical policy, pension plan and access to world class learning.

Welcome to SITA

SITA is the world’s leading specialist in air transport communications and information technology. We don’t just connect the global aviation industry. We apply decades of experience and expertise to address almost every core business, operational, baggage, and passenger process in air transport.

We design, build, and support technology solutions all with one vision to create easy air travel every step of the way. As an organization, we cover 95% of all international air travel destinations and work with over 2,800 air transport and government customers in every corner of the globe. Are you ready to explore the opportunities?

In case of issues with uploading your CV or accessing the application system, please contact us @ careers@sita.aero

description:
Sobre a vaga
Are you looking for an exciting new move in your career?

SHEIN is an international online fashion retailer that’s in an exciting new phase of our continued growth!

If you like to work fast, collaboratively and understand the true value of idea generation with a ‘customer first’ mentality - you’re on your way to being a right fit for us. SHEIN prides itself on our agility within our business model and talent base so we’re looking for dreamers and doers.
As a fast growing business with an immediate need to innovatively build out our talent infrastructure, we’re looking for a dynamic professional who is keen to work in an agile and evolving business environment. There’s work, and then there’s the work you’re passionate about - The kind of work that’s an extension of who you are. That’s the work we do at SHEIN.
Our values consist of putting the customer first, going all out, acting and adapting, continuous learning & innovating and encouraging synergy & collaboration at all levels within the business.

For this position you'll be working at SHEIN's business team, leading the way for new sellers to become a qualified e commerce player, providing solutions to bring high quality sellers to customers and platform.

Job Description

Provide the new sellers professional training of becoming a Shein online seller
Assist and solve issues regarding to sellers questions
Identify and capture sellers needs and difficulties and provide customoized solutions
Encourage and guide new sellers to have good performance during the start-up period
Improve the level of seller satisfaction

Job Requirements :

Bachelors degree or above, more than 3 years working experience in the same position.
Good systematic and logical thinking ability, understand the complexity of things, and be able to consider problems from a global perspective.
English is mandatory, Mandarin is a plus.
Experience in e-commerce is a plus

company: {'name': 'Guardian Industries', 'size': '+ de 10.001 funcionários', 'sector': 'Fabricação de vidro, cerâmica e concreto'}

description:
Sobre a vaga
Description

Analista de Logística Pleno

A Guardian oferece um ambiente empreendedor e com uma cultura única, onde nosso objetivo é que cada funcionário e suas famílias tenham uma vida plena e saudável. No momento, estamos recrutando um Analista de Logística que irá crescer em nossa cultura.

Descrição Da Vaga

Analisar, planejar, organizar a grade de carregamento, conforme capacidades e premissas.
Interface direta com armazens e customer service, buscando comunicação fluida, eliminação de ruídos e gargalos, com foco na satisfação do cliente.
Monitorar e controlar as entregas aos clientes dentro das expectativas e garantir informação rápida em caso de desvios.
Realizar análises de indicadores de resultados (SLA’s dos transportadores e KPIs da area), apontando desvios e plano de ação em busca de otimização e produtividade.
Garantir visibilidade de dados que contribuam para a execução das atividades, visando produtividade, redução dos custos e qualidade no atendimento ao cliente.
Propor melhorias com base na gestão da mudança e gerenciar arquivos de suporte (negociações de fretes, procedimentos e demais arquivos que suportam a operação).

Todas essas responsabilidades serão guiadas, desenvolvidas e executadas através da cultura interna da empresa de Gerenciamento Baseado em Princípios que prioriza a evolução e transformação individual.

Requisitos

Formação superior em Administração de Empresas, Engenharia, Logística e/ou áreas correlatas
Boa comunicação, habilidades interpessoais e de organização
Excel nível avançado
Experiencia na área de logística
Diferenciais: Conhecimento em Power BI e ingles intermediario/avançado.

required_skills: ['Comunicação', 'Microsoft Excel', 'Habilidades analíticas', 'Resolução de problemas']
description:
Sobre a vaga
About The Company

If you see technology as there to smooth your path in life, our team does too: Your Path, Our Journey.

We believe in people who transform their paths through technology. Technology that connects people who are good at what they do and which practices diversity to create and share those paths that we (as yet!) do not even know about. Our journey is in the smile of every talented person who brings revolution to the world from Brazil - whether with in-app transportation (99) or digital payments (99Pay).

To make life easier for millions of people every day, we are in the driving seat as part of DiDi Chuxing, the world's largest transport, and convenient platform. And so, we can say, with great pride, that we are pioneers in creating solutions, starting in Brazil, that grow in scale and have positive impacts in a range of other countries.

Whether creating projects from scratch or continually improving our solutions, we like challenges that give us butterflies, and that's why we work with intensity, at a fast pace, with respect, collaboration, and partnership. On this journey, we also create learning and strengthen ourselves in diversity as a fundamental aspect that makes us stand out for our growth day after day.

About The Team/role

99Moto is the top growing business in 99! Do you want to be a part of this Journey?

The City Operations team is a part of 2wheels (99moto, 99Entrega and more to come...). Some of our main responsabilities are: city incentives strategy, balance marketplace (growth and engagemet), analysis to maximize our budget (ROI, conversion, allocation), system settings and be the owner of a group of cities (know everything that happens there).

In this role, you'll be...
Learning and building relationships with different teams.
Doing analysis & reports; in a dynamic and challenging environment.
Aim to take quick decisions and actions; familiar with data and numbers, analysis and collaboration.
Responsible for the cities performance; optimize the burn to maximize ROI, growth and engagement; alignment of stakeholders and other team members,
Testing new tools and strategies.

We're eager to be in touch because you have...
Educational background in Engineering, Economics, Exact Sciences, Business Administration or similar.
Good English skills (writing & reading) - you can develop speaking/listening with us.
Good SQL, Excel/Sheets, Slides/PPT skills; Python & DataE will be differential.
Organized and proactive.
Operations or Analytics background is preferred.
We value Diversity! This position is preferably affirmative.

You'll love working at DiDi because...

We create user value

We strive to always create valuable experiences for our users in everything we do. Our focus is to always innovate new experiences that are safe, pleasant and efficient.

We are data-driven

We are strong believers in making informed decisions, that’s why we are data-driven. We can better navigate the business landscape strategically by analyzing valuable metrics.

Win-win Collaboration

Success is a team sport. When we work to help our partners and colleagues win, we win, too. While keeping everyone's best interest at heart, we communicate with candor and execute with excellence in all we do.

We believe in integrity

Integrity is at the very core of our business. We are people who always want to do the right thing. Our intentions are sincere, we speak our minds and listen to each other.

Growth

We always strive to do better. That means venturing beyond our comfort zones, learning from our mistakes, and helping each other grow.

Diversity and Inclusion

Diversity is one of our biggest strengths. Our differences are what make us distinct. We respect each other and believe in equal opportunities for all.

We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams

At DiDi, we believe that our differences are our biggest source of strength. That’s why we are committed to promoting equal opportunities to all candidates and employees as an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Employment and advancement decisions at DiDi are always made based on the needs of the position and the qualifications of the candidate. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant based on their gender, age, sexual orientation, nationality, marital status, pregnancy/maternity, disability, race, religion and beliefs, or any other status protected by applicable laws wherever we operate.

We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams, and a workplace that is free from discrimination and harassment, because that’s how we create better products and services, make better decisions and better serve the communities we’re a part of.

company: {'name': 'Launchpad Technologies Inc.', 'size': '51-200 funcionários', 'sector': 'Serviços e consultoria de TI'}
required_skills: ['Comunicação', 'Git', 'Operações de sistemas', 'Resolução de problemas', 'Solução de problemas técnicos']
description:
Sobre a vaga
Recognized as one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies, Launchpad provides next-generation integration platform capabilities for connecting and managing enterprise automation and data integration. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, our operations span both North and South Americas, with a second headquarter located in Santiago, Chile.

In 2021, we were recognized as the winner of the BC Tech Associations Technology Impact Awards 'Company of The Year: Growth'. We recognize the global truth that today, every company is a tech company. To succeed, every company everywhere needs their data and workflows to be integrated and automated. That understanding gave us the confidence to compete with our sector's leading providers, win top-level contracts, and build a truly world-class list of clients that includes Walmart, GM, TIME Magazine, Salesforce, Tableau, Splunk, Bolt.com, Freedom House, and more.

Our vision is to bring people and technology together to work seamlessly to achieve extraordinary business outcomes and create more efficient societies. If this sounds like something you want to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.

Responsibilities:

Support: Ensure the state of the data platform and data pipelines running on the platform are healthy and jobs are completed per their SLAs; responding to incidents as they arise.
Troubleshooting: Investigate any problems that arise with our data pipelines (Python code), data (SQL / Snowflake), orchestration (Airflow), and infrastructure as needed and prescribe solutions when possible.
On-Call Support: 24/7 on-call rotation with primary and secondary coverage which rotates weekly. Estimated number of total participants is 5.
Systems Administration: Administer the users, their access, application configurations, upgrades, etc of the following platforms: Tableau, GitLab, Snowflake, Alteryx, Matillion, Airflow
RBAC Administration: Respond to ServiceNow requests and communicate with our users when necessary in order to grant the user proper access to Tableau, Snowflake, or specified data sets.

Required Experience:

Linux: 3 years of experience
Python: 3 years of experience
SQL: 3 years of experience
Git: 1 years of experience

Bonus Experience:

AWS
Airflow
DBT
Docker
Terraform
K8
Hashicorp Vault

Soft skills:

Enthusiastic about tech and the data domain
Strong problem solving skills
Collaborative
Takes initiative without being reckless (considers how their actions impacts other people/systems)

Why work for Launchpad?

100% remote
People first culture
Excellent compensation
Hardware setup for working from home
Work with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and Asia
Training allowances
Personal time off (PTO) for vacations, study leave, personal time, etc.
...and more!

At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then you are the future of Launchpad. Launchpad is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are respected and treated equally.

Are you ready to elevate your career at Launchpad? We want to hear your story! Contact us today.

description:
Sobre a vaga
Summary/Objective
The Korber Developer performs analysis and defines functionality for system improvements and new applications. This position design, develops, tests and supports enhancements made to appropriate applications used.
Essential Functions
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
1. Designs and Codes applications following specifications using the appropriate tools.
2. Maintains and modifies existing applications under direction from senior staff members and provides direction for others.
3. Performs maintenance programming for existing version. Performs custom programming at customer request.
4. Follows best practices for architecture of product.
5. Participates in defining and implementing technical direction.
6. A key contributor in selecting and implementing technical architecture of assigned projects.
7. Performs or reviews system analysis, design, programming, testing, debugging, and documentation for assigned projects.
8. Works with support and documentation groups to provide technical and user training and manuals for new systems and major system enhancements.
9. Participates in process improvement and acts as a catalyst for change.
10.Effectively works with peers, team members, and other departments.
11.Participates on project teams for assigned system projects; analyzes improvements and new applications and develops requirements and specifications with team.
12.Helps develop specification, program, and documentation standards.
13.Provides support for appropriate applications
14.Acts as a contributor on projects and drive projects, from a technical standpoint, to independently resolve issues.
15.Contributes to the success of projects by applying demonstrated knowledge.
16.Performs other related duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications
Education and Experience
Bachelor's degree preferably in Computer Science or related program, or appropriate experience.
Must have previous Supply Chain knowledge.
Must have previous High Jump/ Korber development experience.

Empresa localizada na cidade de curitiba/pr do ramo logística, com 1 funcionários, contrata analista de banco de dados Elaborar relatórios e dashboards, utilizando visões gerenciais e estratégicas para apoio à coordenação nas tomadas de decisão, acompanhamento diário dos principais indicadores da empresa, garantindo que a informação chegue a todos os times envolvidos, além do acompanhamento e follow-up das ações (pmo); desenvolver e implementar análises de dados, entendendo fatores que impactem nos resultados e no custo do negócio, e apresentar os resultados à equipe de trabalho; identificar, analisar e interpretar tendências ou padrões em conjuntos de dados complexos; realização de demais atividades correlatas e inerentes ao cargo, assim como atividades atribuídas pelo seu superior imediato. company: {'name': 'Unisys', 'size': '+ de 10.001 funcionários', 'sector': 'Serviços e consultoria de TI'}
required_skills: ['Banco de dados', 'Analítica de dados', 'Análise de pontos de função', 'Engenharia de dados', 'Gestão de projetos', 'Graduate Entry', 'Habilidades analíticas', 'Indicadores-chave de desempenho', 'Levantamento de requisitos', 'Requisitos de negócio']
description:
Sobre a vaga
We Believe in Better!

We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people’s lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.

At Unisys, we believe in better! Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a global diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.

Our associates are at the forefront of everything we do, driving our clients’ successes while giving back to communities and making this world a safer and more secure place to live and work. Our success is a direct result of the work of our people who live and breathe our Core Beliefs. Simply put, we believe in better lives. Join us!

Learn more about Unisys and our key solution offerings: Unisys, Stealth™, CloudForte®, InteliServe™

What success looks like in this role:

O(a) Analista de Métricas SR, será responsável por: planejar e executar o gerenciamento de análise de métricas de softwares com técnicas de APF & Snap; realizar mensurações para todos os itens de backlog do produto; manter os planejamentos e demais artefatos da disciplinas de métricas, bem como realizar demais atividades correlatas e inerentes ao cargo.

Atividades a serem desenvolvidas
Planejar e executar o gerenciamento de análise de métricas de software, com as técnicas de APF, SNAP e demais técnicas previstas neste CONTRATO.
Obter o entendimento das funcionalidades (funções de dados e transacionais), características não funcionais e demais requisitos e regras de negócio junto aos Gestores de Negócio, Product Owners, Analistas de Negócio, Analistas de Requisitos, Analistas de Banco de Dados, Desenvolvedores e demais membros do time de desenvolvimento.
Realizar as mensurações para todos os itens de backlog do produto.
Executar mensurações para um escopo parcial ou total de funcionalidades das soluções.
Construir e manter os planejamentos e demais artefatos da disciplina de métricas afins com o papel, conforme metodologia vigente.
Propor e aplicar, de maneira contínua, melhorias nos artefatos, na metodologia, nos processos de trabalho e na sua forma de atuação, com base na coleta de feedback da equipe, inspeções de qualidade e indicadores de desempenho.

You will be successful in this role if you have:

Qualificações

Necessárias
Graduação completa em: Análise e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas, Ciências da Computação, Engenharia de Dados ou demais áreas correlatas;
Certificação em Scrum Product Owner;
Experiência sólida em levantamento de requisitos de Negócio;
Experiência com levantamento das informações através de entrevistas com os clientes finais e gestores de desenvolvimento;
Experiência com elaboração de processos que são utilizados na confecção dos sistemas e aplicações.

Desejáveis
Pós-Graduação em Gestão de Projetos;
Conhecimento de técnicas de estimativas.

At Unisys, we believe in better! Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a global diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.

Our associates are at the forefront of everything we do, driving our clients’ successes while giving back to communities and making this world a safer and more secure place to live and work. What success looks like in this role:

O(a) Analista de Métricas SR, será responsável por: planejar e executar o gerenciamento de análise de métricas de softwares com técnicas de APF & Snap; realizar mensurações para todos os itens de backlog do produto; manter os planejamentos e demais artefatos da disciplinas de métricas, bem como realizar demais atividades correlatas e inerentes ao cargo.

Atividades a serem desenvolvidas
Planejar e executar o gerenciamento de análise de métricas de software, com as técnicas de APF, SNAP e demais técnicas previstas neste CONTRATO.
Obter o entendimento das funcionalidades (funções de dados e transacionais), características não funcionais e demais requisitos e regras de negócio junto aos Gestores de Negócio, Product Owners, Analistas de Negócio, Analistas de Requisitos, Analistas de Banco de Dados, Desenvolvedores e demais membros do time de desenvolvimento.
Realizar as mensurações para todos os itens de backlog do produto.
Executar mensurações para um escopo parcial ou total de funcionalidades das soluções.
Construir e manter os planejamentos e demais artefatos da disciplina de métricas afins com o papel, conforme metodologia vigente.
Propor e aplicar, de maneira contínua, melhorias nos artefatos, na metodologia, nos processos de trabalho e na sua forma de atuação, com base na coleta de feedback da equipe, inspeções de qualidade e indicadores de desempenho.

You will be successful in this role if you have:

Qualificações

Necessárias
Graduação completa em: Análise e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas, Ciências da Computação, Engenharia de Dados ou demais áreas correlatas;
Certificação em Scrum Product Owner;
Experiência sólida em levantamento de requisitos de Negócio;
Experiência com levantamento das informações através de entrevistas com os clientes finais e gestores de desenvolvimento;
Experiência com elaboração de processos que são utilizados na confecção dos sistemas e aplicações.

Desejáveis
Pós-Graduação em Gestão de Projetos;
Conhecimento de técnicas de estimativas.
